Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel great service and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Twinmommy123
Reviews.Content: We had a double supreme room and it was spacious. Breakfast is included and you can have it delivered to your room daily for no extra fee. There is free wi if and the front desk is extremely helpful. It is very close to San Marco plaza and very near most attractions. We had a lovely time and would go back here in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Sylviane D
Reviews.Content: 3 days in Venice are not a lot, so you want your hotel to be where the action is. Hotel Flora is perfectly located: 2 to 3 minutes away from piazza San Marco in a quiet street and a short walk from 2 Vaporeto stops. The family hotel is small and very cozy. You simply feel at home surrounded by old wooden furniture. The welcoming staff is extremely friendly. Breakfast is served in a salon filled with photographs of local beauties from the family's previous photo business. Notice the tables and chairs that seem to come from a doll's house!!! Too cute! Why did we pick that hotel among all others? because of its garden, a peaceful private green enclosure in this stone city. The hotel also offers free internet (but be careful as we got hacked...after all it is Venice) and a gym. We got the family suite with its own entrance. The suite is composed of 2 rooms and 2 bathrooms. Like the chairs and the tables, the bathtubs come from the same doll's house. Tiny bathtubs where you can barely fit your whole body (petite size) forcing your knees in your mouth and most of your body out of the water. Suggestions to improve the bathrooms were made!! For a place like Venice, Hotel Flora is definitely a place to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, close and scenic”
Reviews.Author: Teresa_DAnna
Reviews.Content: Everything was exactly what you wanted in a hotel. The view from our room was their cute little garden piazza. Our bed was comfortable. Our down comforters kept us warm in the Venice spring. Their breakfast was tasty, and their waitstaff curtious. It was everything you wanted for tired feet after being pleasantly lost for hours walking through the maze that is Venice. One thing to note though. My boyfriend is an uneuropean 6ft tall, which makes it tough to shower in their tiny little bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamesE99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on our first trip to Venice. We were totally impressed with the location, charm and service of this lovely hotel. In particular the personal and welcoming service from every member of staff, which was exceptional. Would recommend it to everybody

Reviews.Title: “still a charmer!”
Reviews.Author: RomeHome
Reviews.Content: the Hotel Flora has become my go-to hotel in Venice: you can't beat the location, the staff is wonderful (for the most part), and the charm of the hotel unbeatable. The hotel isn't on a canal so don't get your hopes up, but it is down a quiet little alley, right next to Bulgari, and is truly a hidden gem among Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Magical Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwwright
Reviews.Content: Its was our first visit to Venice, the position of the hotel is prime and everywhere is within walking distance. We stayed in the height of winter the temperture outside was well below 0 but the room was nice and warm and cosy. We had breakfast delivereid to the room at no extra cost, nice breakfast of croissants, bread, cereal, yogurt & coffee, a great start to the day. We used the waterbus(Alilaguna Lines) from Marco Polo airport it cost 25 euros return & takes about an 1 hour 15mins. The hotel staff are very polite and helpful, after a long day walking around venice it was nice to go back to the hotel bar for a beer & a bellini from our charming bar tender. A good tip is to turn left from the hotel away from San Marco where the bars & restaurants were alot more reasonable. A truly magical little hotel, you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in true Venice style”
Reviews.Author: telegirl68
Reviews.Content: I was here for 2 nights with my daughter, and my brother with whom I shared a room, and my brother and his wife. It's hard to find if you're not used to Venice, but an easy walk from the vaporetto stop (sorry, I forget which one), even with roller bags (we each brought one small roller bag, so we weren't over-burdened). Perfect location from which to walk Venice, very close to Plaza San Marco, etc. The hotels down a tiny little alley which is charming, we took many photos before we even got to the hotel! Nice lobby, elegance but mini-sized, like most European hotels. Very polite and knowledgeable concierge who always addressed us by name and sent us to two wonderful restaurants. Our rooms were small, with that very Italian aesthetic, less opulent than Parisian hotels, but nicely furnished. Great linens, very clean, a view down into the courtyard where they serve breakfast. Tiny bathroom, but comfortable and serviceable. My brother is 6'1" and didn't have trouble with the size of things. We got settled and went down to the bar for a glass of prosecco before taking a walk. This little lounge is also very charming, and we were given some snacky things. The chairs are low tables are small, but very pretty, well maintained. Service here was impeccable. The breakfast was quite good, great coffee, eggs cooked well, good bread, fruit. I think they had some nice meats and pastries as well. I thought the price was in line with Venice hotels of this ilk. Everything is expensive when travelling in Europe, and this was high season. I bet they'd give good rates for off-season travellers. I'd definitely recommend this hotel unless you dislike small spaces, in which case, you might want to avoid Europe altogether!

Reviews.Title: “Most Charming Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: professorRaleigh
Reviews.Content: We've been to Venice several times and have stayed in 6 different places, but we keep going back to the Hotel Flora. It is absolutely our favorite and first choice from now on. The location is so central between San Marco and the Rialto. But, the best part is its ambience and charm. Just precious. Great service, too!

Reviews.Title: “Garden Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Sue L
Reviews.Content: We picked the Hotel Flora after much research, and on a Rick Steves recommendation. We stayed in the Family suite (two couples) which included two bedrooms and two bathrooms at a rate cheaper than two separate rooms. The rooms and bathrooms are very tiny but it seems that is common in Venice. What makes it worthwhile to stay here is the lovely garden area where we had breakfast and afternoon drinks. Service was wonderful - thanks to Stefano. The location was perfect - a short walk to San Marco square, and convenient to everywhere else we wanted to go. When you first arrive, look for the small Hotel Flora sign on the building at the entrance to the narrow walkway that leads back to the hotel entrance. On a side note: We highly recommend attending an opera performance at the nearby Musica Palazzo. We attended La Traviata and it was an experience like no other!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but chose for the right reasons”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeChef
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel without knowing much about it. Last time I was in Venice I was a starving graduate student staying in hostels so this seemed fine enough and the location could not have been better, right next to piazza San Marco. We chose a larger room for 220 euros per night since we are familiar with the space constraints of European hotels although I saw the smaller rooms and they seemed fine enough for the price (much lower than our rate for larger room). However, I chose hotel Flora specifically because they have a gym but that was a bit disappointing. Perhaps Hotel Flora can charge more for the fact they have a gym but there is only one treadmill and it is reserved for their private training clients and we could never get on it. Next time, I would book a room in Venice through a third party engine to get better comparative pricing for the area. Breakfast was great and they have a lovely garden but it was too cold to enjoy it. Basic things like the size of the seats in the breakfast room may not work for the average American and the bathrooms are tiny no matter want room you get. The staff was nice and informative directing us to restaurants, tours and taxis. We ate at the restaurant across the street, la Caravalla at the hotel Albergo Saturnia and would consider staying there next time. They have nicer common areas and slightly nicer rooms for less money during the winter. Their restaurant and cocktail area adds a lot to the experience albeit expensive but it is Venice after all! Hotel Flora could easily be better than other hotels at it's price point in the area by making some slight improvements to the amenities that have, especially the gym which is in a beautiful building next door. Adding another treadmill to the gym, adding directional signs to find the gym. Adding more pillows for the rooms, at least the larger rooms and updating the bathrooms a bit to include new hair dryers. Overall it is a nice place and we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “really special place”
Reviews.Author: Cathe d
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Flora and our stay was gorgeous. The location can't be better as you are few steps away from San Marco square but in a quiet narrow street out of the main passage. Our room was perfect, confortable, clean and beautifully decorated with an incredible view over Venetian roofs and gardens. Overall they help us with usefull suggestions regarding what to do and what to visit ...we discovered hidden venetian treasures. Also the Gym studio is very nice and their personal trainer really helpfull. The Flora was a perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Just a magical experience”
Reviews.Author: Valerie I
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing time, the staff was so kind and helpful ( it was are first time in Venice) the location its simply priceless and the ambiance at the lovely garden just magical and peaceful, the room.... so romantic, we are definitely coming back for Carnaval To Hotel Flora. We loved it ! Valerie & Jack

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis in the middle of the hubbub”
Reviews.Author: CharlesRevier
Reviews.Content: In addition to the Rick Steves recommendation, we were attracted to this hotel by their charming Web site. Unlike some of the other Trip Advisor reviewers, we were not disappointed. My wife and I, our two daughters and their husbands, and our baby granddaughter stayed here for 5 nights in early August. The hotel met our expectations perfectly. The garden was just as it looks on the Web site, a beautiful spot for breakfast. Yes, the breakfast is Continental, but it met our needs and had enough variety that we did not get bored returning for 5 successive mornings. The staff were extremely helpful with every question I came up with. Although I usually took the stairs, the elevator was very welcome at times. I thought the furnishings and decorations in all the public areas were lovely. The rooms were small, yes, but I thought the furnishings were nice and the bed very comfortable. The rooms were always very clean. The location is fantastic--a five-minute walk from Piazza San Marco along the busy and crowded Calle XXII Marzo, but the hotel is some 200 yards away at the end of a tiny, quiet side street, and returning to it after a busy, exhausting day of sightseeing always felt like returning to a peaceful oasis. And the wireless Internet always worked, which is more than I can say about some hotels. But here's the clincher for me. Honesty?! I made the reservations by email, and the hotel's confirmation promised us a Rick Steves discount. I didn't have a chance to review the amount we should have been charged when we checked out; I just signed the credit card charge slip and we left. When we got home, I discovered that the amount of the discount was 45 euros less than I thought it would be. With some trepidation, since I had signed the charge slip without a quibble, I emailed and asked that my account be credited for the additional amount. To my relief, they replied promptly, readily admitted their mistake, and gave me the credit on my credit card. I was very impressed with their honesty and willingness to make things right. So as far as we were concerned, out stay at the Hotel Flora was a delightful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Rick Steves please remove this hotel from your book”
Reviews.Author: sunsetsail
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in need of a serious makeover. We had room 5 and if are brave enough to stay in this hotel, definitely ask for another room if they give you this one. The room was small like all in Venice but the bathroom was tiny. You had to sit on the toilet sideways because there's not enough room between the toilet and wall. The shower is so small that you have to open the door to bend down if you drop the soap. Washing your feet is a challenge. And I am a thin person so anyone who is big will have a problem even fitting in the shower. The room was not very clean and the furnishings were old. The safe is not much bigger than a cigarette pack so was pretty much useless. But the thing that surprised me the most is their lack of honesty. I left a tablet computer in the room and when I called and told them exactly where they would find it, amazingly it wasn't there. i even offered a reward to have this returned but their response was that I must have left it somewhere else. I would not have expected a family owned hotel to steal from their clients. We stayed here because of the recommendations on this site and the info in Rick Steve's book but I now see that the reviews here are not as favorable. The location was good but there are plenty of other better hotels in the same area. Breakfast was included but the selection was very limited. I would not. recommend this run down hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, garden and service”
Reviews.Author: Zosh_11
Reviews.Content: This was our third time back at the Flora, which distinguishes itself by its superb location, friendly service and lovely garden, which is a real haven of peace and quiet in the middle of a busy little city. I had booked for a "Biennale package", which apparently the hotel had discontinued, but given that I had a written confirmation of what it included, the hotel agreed to cover the additional cost of the Biennale tickets. I was glad to have the written confirmation with me, however. Anyone who walks well will be able to reach any part of the city within 45 minutes from the Flora, and as one gets father and farther away from the center, the number of tourists appreciably declines. Further, the place is within 5 minutes from the boat dock to the airport, so if your suitcase is heavy, you needn't take haul it up and down too many bridges. The Flora service was nice: friendly and accommodating. Breakfast includes fruit salad, yoghurt, crossiant, toast, cereals, and juice. For an extra fee, you can order scrambled eggs, which someone in the guest book wrote were "the best in Europe". While we have always come in November and had found Venice dry, there was "high water" this year.. so we had to buy rubber boots on the first day. It was an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Flora - Not Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: deRohan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Venice on a number of occasions and I always like to experience a new hotel on each visit, but I did not enjoy this hotel one bit! We all know and accept that Venice's uniqueness often requires compromise and a degree of understanding with accommodation standards in all categories. I was attracted to Hotel Flora due to its reputed charm, only to discover to my disappointment that it is one of those hotels that features beautiful rooms on its website which do not match reality! I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in a spartan, single room (200 Euros per night) and in my view, the hotel is tired and needs refurbishment. The room was shabby with cheap, spartan furnishings, dirty walls and with small stained, threadbare rugs on the timber floor. The bathroom was tiny (as are most in Venice) with a cracked handbasin and toilet flush mechanism that fell apart every time it was used. The bed was one of the worst I have slept in at any hotel - ever. It comprised two very short single mattresses pushed together on a double base to form a very small double bed. The mattresses were raised at the centre join and sloped down towards the sides, so you constantly had the sensation that you were going to roll off the edge of the bed. The mattress was hard, lumpy and uneven and two pillows provided were old, hard and flat in the middle from overuse. I am average height but the bed was too short for me. Both bed and pillows were way past replacement date!! Perhaps worse - the wall adjoining the next room was so thin that I could clearly hear all conversations and activity (you can use your imagination here) of the two guests next door. This was disgraceful and really unacceptable. The buffet breakfast was sparse and with very few choices and many very basic breakfast items that were included on the buffet of other hotels I had stayed in within this category had to be ordered and paid for as "extras" and they were not cheap. (For example: Ham 8 Euros, scrambled eggs 6 Euros, Bacon and eggs 8 Euros, Salami 7 Euros, etc.) This gave an impression of meanness and money-grabbing. On a more concerning note, my room was on the top floor of a wing at the end of a corridor with no exit. In the event of a fire, I would have had no escape route. Had I not pre-paid my accommodation, I would most certainly have checked out. I would not recommended this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boyfromoz_8
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Hotel Flora early in October. We had a smaller room booked for the first night and then a larger one for the next two. Both were neat & clean and presented in a traditional manner. The staff were excellent and attended to everything required. We particularly enjoyed the breakfast in the peaceful courtyard each morning. We'd be happy to stay at Hotel Flora if in Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lc5528
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Hotel Flora because it was close to where friends were staying, but much less expensive. There were three of us, and the room was small, but there was still enough space for all of us. The bathroom was narrow, but clean. The beds and pillows were hard, but usable. Overall, this was a nice, quiet place to stay in the heart of Venice. The front desk helped us make dinner reservations and provided us with directions. The garden is very nice and the breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “The Emperor's New Clothes”
Reviews.Author: Linda M
Reviews.Content: The Emperorâ€™s New Clothes I am wondering how so many good reviews have been posted on Trip Advisor about the Hotel Flora. Like the Emperorâ€™s new clothes, I was just not able to see it. Perhaps there is a section of the hotel we did not know about. Based on Trip Advisor reviews I made a reservation for October 10th-13th for my daughter, my granddaughter and myself at the Hotel Flora. Our accommodation was the family â€œsuiteâ€�; two very small adjacent rooms with two bathrooms. The small part I could live with since European hotels are sometimes like that although these were miniscule. However small spaces can certainly be fresh and charming, but unfortunately these rooms were not. Both of the bathrooms had peeling paint and cracked tiles. The door handle in the smaller bathroom fell off the door repeatedly; once I was locked in. The curtains, rugs and furniture are in serious need of updating. The rugs in particular need to be changed. Shabby, depressing, and run down would properly describe our rooms. Upon check out, I mentioned my disappointment to one of the managers who responded with this, â€œpeople who stay in the family rooms with children do not care about the decorationâ€� REALLY? I wanted my 11 year old granddaughter to feel our trip was special but instead I was mortified that I had chosen the Hotel Flora. When we checked out I suggested the management take a walk upstairs for a hard look at our rooms. My guess is that nobody had seriously evaluated them for a quite a while although after the fact, I did notice similar criticisms about hotel accommodations on Trip Advisor. To my surprise, the hotel â€˜s Trip Advisor responses seem to focus on how serious they are about the hotel and to blame the guests for not letting them know about these problems. Asking for extra towels is one thing but it is not the responsibility of the guest to inform the management of cracked tiles, dirty rugs, and peeling paint. The management needs to be concerned with and on top of that constantly. Restaurant recommendations were simply non -existent. Three nights in a row different front desk staff suggested the same restaurant which we walked out of the first night when the waiter asked us which hotel sent us. You can guess what that meant. Why didnâ€™t we check out? Our time was very limited and we had plans every day that did not include searching for and moving to another hotel. The location is great. The cappuccino was very good. I would be embarrassed to recommend the Hotel Flora to anyone and would certainly never return. Maybe there are nice rooms somewhere in the hotel but I wouldnâ€™t take a chance. Like the Emperorâ€™s New Clothes, I just did not see it.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian charm”
Reviews.Author: LosGatostraveler
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I each had double rooms for single occupancy at our "home in Venice". They were very quiet and the air-conditioning adjusted to the desired termperature. A perfect experience began with the concierge arranged transfer from Marco Polo airport. A driver met us as we exited , having seen no customs or immigration authorities, and took us and our baggage to his SUV. He drove us to Piazze Reale and then escorted us to our private water taxi. What a lovely ride through the Grand Canal at twilight to a stop near our hotel. There the porter, Manuele, helped us make a great leap up to the bank and took our bags. Never could have done it without his helping hand. When we left after a week the concierge again arranged a private water taxi to the train station. Throughout our stay every need was beautifully taken care of. If we returned after a day of sightseeing too tired to go out for dinner, Vicenzio the factotum served drinks.prepared a light repast and served it., all with a sincere smile. At breakfast the waiter told me where my daughter was sitting and brought a cappucino without being asked. The housekeeper was a stylish sight with her pink uniform and elegent coiffure. All in all, our stay was so enjoyable we regretted leaving.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Daisymaisy_10
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel tucked away behind the scenes. Only 5 mins walk away from St Marks. Our room was quiet and comfortable overlooking the garden. The garden is a charming place to have breakfast or just sit and enjoy the ambience. The staff were very helpful. The room and bathroom were very clean as were the bed linen and towels. Lots of nice toiletry goodies in the bathroom. Shame we only had two nights there.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian style in the heart of Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Gwelly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in September. Easily reached from the Alilaguna line but I would recommend one of the faster methods from the airport for a little more money. A good welcome at reception and help with our small amount of luggage. We stayed in a "corner" room, very spacious and comfortable. Bathroom narrow and long, some would say small! If you are very large not the place for you! Decor Venetian style definitely not chain-hotel style. We took aperativos in the terrace - a veritable oasis away from the throng of tourists. Giovanni's recommendations for Osteria's etc were very good...especially if you are after fish and away from the crowds. Breakfast was again taken on the terrace - a very good selection of fresh fruit, cereals, cold meats and pastries. All in all a very good place to stay close to San Marco's. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location - quiet & beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ELP98
Reviews.Content: We spent two days at the Hotel Flora with our daughters. We were delighted to arrive and discover we were in a family suite with the girls having their own room - AC worked well. Breakfast on the patio was a perfect way to start the day. It is a very short walk from San Marco square (opposite the Duomo/Pitti Palace) off one of the fanciest shopping streets. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “good value in expensive Venice, rooms are perfumed”
Reviews.Author: jooleea
Reviews.Content: We had a satisfactory experience staying here for two nights in early January. We stayed in the lowest price room, and it's a good value for such an expensive city. Our room was actually larger than I expected, and breakfast is quite good in a charming sitting room. Front desk service was sufficient, but not that helpful, and as stated by other reviewers, their restaurant recommendation was incredibly touristy and terrible. My issue with this hotel is the smell. When we arrived and entered our room, it smelled like the housekeeping staff had sprayed the place with a bottle of cheap perfume. I suffer from allergies, and the smell was enough to give anyone a migraine. I called the front desk, and they sent housekeeping to change the sheets, which helped, but not much. We kept the window open the three days we were there (in January!) and it never aired out. Maybe you can request in advance - no perfume!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Mimia2
Reviews.Content: Our room was quiet and comfortable with enough room to fully unpack for our 3 day stay. The room and the bathroom were very clean, with nice linens and soaps. The front desk staff were very helpful and provided excellent advice on restaurants and directions. The breakfasts were nice and served in the inner courtyard garden which was charming. Our only complaint is very minor. The free wi-fi was difficult to access from our room which was down a hallway towards the back of the hotel. Some days we had to go into the lobby to connect, which was somewhat inconvenient, however, there was a small parlour adjacent to the lobby where we could sit as we worked on our laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable! An amazing gem hidden in the best part of town!”
Reviews.Author: BelleBearSyd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Flora for two nights in August, just on a whim. We booked the hotel the morning of leaving Milan and didnt hope for much, what with it being peak season, gorgeous weather, and a last minute booking. This hotel is AMAZING! It's right in the snooty part of town, tucked down beside Bulgari, Burberry, etc. The staff are amazing, the most friendly people in Italy, but I guess that's because the hotel has been family run for decades. The establishment itself is pure old-world class. Everything was perfect, the beds the BEST in Europe, as are the pillows! Breakfast in the courtyard is stunning. If we could live here and never go back to reality we'd be the happiest people on earth!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy find that feels like home”
Reviews.Author: GeorgicaPond
Reviews.Content: A wonderfully cozy boutique hotel that makes you feel like you are staying in a private home. Small, but charmingly furnished room, lovely breakfasts in the beautiful private garden, and a delightfully friendly concierge in Giovanni who goes out of his way to be helpful day or night. The hotel has a great location.....one block in from a private water taxi stop and an easy 3 minute walk from St. Mark's Square, yet just far enough away to be out of the madding crowds. This is the place to stay when you want to relax and disappear without fuss. It has none of the grandeur, room conveniences (including sufficient outlets) or full restaurant services of the top hotels. In the nicest possible way, you feel like you are staying at your dowager grandmother's private residence and that she has instructed her staff to make sure you are happy. What you forgo in luxury you make up for in intimacy. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and central”
Reviews.Author: Jill1354
Reviews.Content: Hotel Flora is midst the designer shops and a stone's throw from San Marco - also an easy walk from the airport ferry - yet does not break the bank. The hotel staff are absolutely charming, and the garden is a perfect retreat for al fresco breakfast and a cold beer any time. The room we stayed in was small but perfectly adequate. The bathroom (behind a space-saving sliding door for very good reason) had an excellent shower but no room to swing the proverbial cat; however for a couple of nights this would not have been a problem. Hotel Flora is pretty and elegant and a great choice for a short stopover in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, delightful setting”
Reviews.Author: Astrobenandemily
Reviews.Content: A brilliant location, a short walk to St Marks. Very quaint hotel, small rooms, but that's to be expected. Wonderful outdoor dining / garden area, staff were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic at any age”
Reviews.Author: archiebeck
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, clean, friendly. Well located, yet quiet at night. And Oh that blood orange juice for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Megan M
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent staff, breakfast was delicious, and our favourite part was the "oasis" garden sitting area. Also, the room was spacious for our family of 5!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and hope to return”
Reviews.Author: Colourqueen
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel, with lovely staff. Nothing was too much trouble for them, in fact after we left and got to the other end of Italy, I realised that I had left a bag of shopping there under a chair in our room. I phoned Roberto and he tracked it down, and kindly arranged to have it posted home to Australia for me. Now that really is service! But more about the hotel, upon arrival everything was swift, we were checked in and bags bought up to our room promptly. As we were travelling as a couple and our 15 year old, they gave us a "sort of" apartment. It was actually 2 rooms, each with its own bathroom, both rooms come off a private corridor that can be securely locked at night. Fantastic for families, and nice and quiet at the end of a hallway. Breakfast was served in the dining area/bar, loads of food to choose from. The staff reminded us a bit of faulty towers, the way they rushed around sorting tables, and extra chairs for guests, but much more politely than Basil Faulty. Very clean hotel, it was in a good central location, not far from restaurants, and shops are everywhere. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: timbosul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights. It takes about 5-10 minutes to walk to it from the ferry stop. Its tucked down a small alley so you have to look up to find the sign. My travel agent gave us a map that made it a little easier. We had a very nice room that overlooked a beautiful courtyard of another property. The hotel is perfectly situated and is about a 2-3 minute walk from San Marco Square, 5-10 minutes to Accademia bridge, 15 minutes to the Rialto Bridge. Its about a 40-45 minute ferry ride to the train station. The hotel staff was very friendly and spoke very good English. The breakfast service was superb and they brought coffee and cappuccino to you. Our kids got hot chocolate and they grated chocolate over the whipped cream. We asked the hotel staff for restaurants on two occasions and both were great dinners - and not overly expensive. The hotel was our favorite of three that we stayed at during our vacation. We would definitely recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: IanRoss82
Reviews.Content: This was the most expensive hotel during our Italy vacation... but definitely worth it for about $210/night for a double. Tucked down a small lane, this hotel lived up to recommendations on Tripadvisor and Lonely Planet. The patio garden was wonderful as an afternoon retreat from the Venice crowds. The service was exceptional.... very helpful and colourful. The rooms were great with soft beds and little noise. The breakfast buffet was tasty. The bar and fitness centre were very nice. But the location... minutes from St. Mark's Square was the biggest bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Return Trip After 25 Years!”
Reviews.Author: Catsitter
Reviews.Content: It was easy enough to find this hotel . Take the water bus to San Marco Vallaresso, take a right at Harryâ€™s Bar, a left at the end of the street, haul your bag over the bridge at San Moise (said to be the ugliest church in Venice, if not in Italy), and turn left down the small alley just past the Bulgari store. And there it is, the Hotel Flora. I stayed there in 1985 on my first visit to Venice, and not much has changed. I booked a single room, knowing that it would be small (and it was!). But then, I wasnâ€™t there to spend time in a hotel room. It's got a nice bed, a shower, a TV (mostly Italian) and air conditioning. What more does a single woman need? One reason I chose to come back to the Hotel Flora is that you can have a â€œlight dinnerâ€� served by the bar manager (Vennichio). I donâ€™t mind traveling alone, but I really donâ€™t like going out for dinner alone, so this was a perfect solution. Vennichio gives me the dinner options, I select the time, and I have a little table in the garden or lounge for my dinner. On my first night, I was the only one dining this way, and enjoyed my gnocchi with artichokes and insalata mista, with a bellini to start, at 9pm. The humidity was very high, and the mosquitoes discovered that I was in the garden, so I slipped inside after finishing dinner, and sat in the lounge with a glass of prosecco to do some reading. The lounge is like an old style parlour, with leaded glass windows, old area rugs, ornate red upholstered furniture, wood spindle tables, lace doilies, Murano glass chandeliers and velvety fabric wallpaper. Oh yes, and air conditioning!!! I found out that most of the staff have been here for many years, and likely were the same people serving me 25 years ago (including Vennichio and the front desk manager). In fact, Vennichio commented that he probably tried to pick me up 25 years ago. I said, "No, I donâ€™t think so -- I was here with a man. But then, you are Italian, so maybe you did try!" As I was coming down the stairs from my room for breakfast a couple of days later (they make perfect cappuccinos and the garden is amazingly beautiful), I heard the man at the front desk saying to the breakfast manager something about "bella donna" and "quattordici" (my room number is 14). I love this hotel! Others were asked for their room number, but they treated me like a queen. Although traveling solo can be lonely at times, itâ€™s times like at the Hotel Flora that makes it a great way to go! The only slight negative was that the wireless Internet was inconsistent. The best place to find a signal was in the lounge or lobby. But again, Venice is to discover, not to sit around and surf the Net!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: 786ZHR
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a 2 night stay in beautiful Venice on our anniversary. From the airport using the Alilaguna shuttle, an easy walk from the San Marco stop, over a couple of bridges, along an elegant street leading to the main piazza, and down a quiet alley leads you to this hidden and quaint hotel. Staff are very polite and helpful but we found the room to be slightly small and the bathroom the size of a spacious closet. Decor makes up for this, as the interior is tastefully done. The best part of the hotel is the enchanting garden, providing a peaceful retreat from which a scrumptious breakfast can be enjoyed. The neighbouring palace is rumoured to be the home of Desdemona from Shakespeares tragic Macbeth, indeed a romantic place, one we would love to return to some day and would recommend as a choice of stay. All in all, value for money considering the steep prices for accommodation in Venicem

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Charming”
Reviews.Author: cjc1261
Reviews.Content: This hotel was filled with old world charm. The accommodations were clean and the staff was pleasant and very helpful. They saw that all of our transportation and touring needs were met in a timely fashion. The gardens are beautiful. A must for your to do list when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “We won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: dahlialady
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not worth the money we spent to stay here. Our room was very rundown, sparce and the bathroom door kept swinging open. Right outside our window, guests were dining. We could hear the people talking and the smoking would drift into our windows. We had to keep the windows shut. The wait staff was nice and the breakfast nice.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: balddoc
Reviews.Content: Just off the main drag we found the Hotel Flora, a real charmer. Great, helpful staff, always accommodating. The rooms are charming, quiet and well appointed. Breakfast (included) is bountiful and delicious. Quite reasonable for central Venice. A must stay.

Reviews.Title: “ADORABLE hotel, PERFECT location. SWEETEST breakfast spot!”
Reviews.Author: 2011Italy
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was perfect for our family. We had 2 rooms with a shared funky little hallway, doors kind of opening every which way. Charming. 2 bathrooms was nice but the SMALLEST bathtubs with a strange slanting base (it is rather alarming and a little dangerous!) which are also the base of the shower so be careful! Free wifi is a great plus! Wonderful breakfast setting in their inner courtyard garden. Walk to San Marco in 5 minutes and you are in the heart of Venice. Friendly and helpful front desk staff. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “The Flora was perfect - loved Venice - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: LuxurynCulture
Reviews.Content: We booked our rooms way ahead in December, as it was for during the season of Biennale, and wisely so - the rates just shot up after January (and note that we stayed in June !) . The booking was handled very professionally and promptly, and when I sent an email to ask for a quiet room, they replied almost immediately to say they would make sure I got a nice room, that was very nice of them. I booked a deluxe double for myself and it was luxurious, a treat. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk from the closest vaporetto stop, and off a posh shopping street, the lane being next to the Bulgari shop, no less. It was a welcoming sight, with the ivy (?) hanging off the walls and their garden just like it is shown on the website. In fact the hotel is nicer than what the pictures show - it is brighter, and we were never bothered by birds. The airconditioning (important in the summer) worked perfectly, and the staff were always attentive and friendly., especially the breakfast staff. Upon arrival, check in was smooth. My room was on the third floor, it looked into the garden, it was quiet, had lovely shutters for the night, one of the the cleanest bathrooms I've seen in Europe, and of a good size. Brilliant shower. The bed was a queen, good mattress (firm) , the TV worked and the room was well lit. Perfect, I could not have asked for more. The public areas were also well-kept, clean, and no-smoking throughout. The hotel and my room were both great to return to, when it got too hot or for an afternoon rest before dinner. The room was always made up perfectly whenever I returned to it, and they sprayed it witha lovely scent too. The hotel is near everything. In the morning, you would be woken up by the sound of birds chirping. Breakfast (if you managed to drag yourself out of bed in time) was a generous selection of breads, eggs, yoghurt, juices, fruit, whatever your morning beverege, toast do-it-yourself. In a cheerful breakfast room off the garden, and you could choose to sit outside if you wanted to. There was free wi-fi, and also paid internet PC off the lobby, which was very convenient, and worth the money (I am not good with fiddling with blackberries). No problems with connection. There's no restaurant but they can make you a hot meal or a sandwich if you really need to stay in. If there is one criticism, that was with restaurant recommendations. They didn't seem to want to recommend the really good ones - Fodors gives pretty accurate reviews - we tried 4 of Fodors' recommendations and they all hit home. So read up and just make your own choices. You really do not need to go to the overpriced Alla Madonna to be ushered into a room that is reserved for tourists, to be served mediocre food by indifferent waiters. We would recommend without hesitation in order of ranking: 1. Vini da Gigio - it is very special - do not miss! 2. Osteria ae Sconte - lovely and romantic , and reasonable 3. Al Paradiso - lovely setting, choose carefully, better for seafood than it is for meats. All had great wines. We spent about 150 Euros including a nice bottle of red for two of us, and we ate very well , and felt that the prices were very fair, considering that Venice is an expensive city. In summary: a) say that you want a quiet room overlooking the garden b) a deluxe double is a very comfortable size for one person c) the breakfast and internet really make a difference d) the hotel is totally ROMANTIC, very clean and very safe for a solo lady traveller even e) Absolutely loved the Flora, Loved Venice, Can't wait to return ! Choose the Flora - forget about those 5-star hotels on the grand canal - this is better.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly charming”
Reviews.Author: nysnork
Reviews.Content: Nothing is cheap in Venice. Quite the contary. So while I can't say Hotel Flora is an exceptional value, I will say we had a nearly perfect experience. It is perfectly located for a shot stay in Venice -- close to major attractions and vaporetto. (For a longer stay I'd probably not stay in San Marco area). Staff was delightful, accommodating and helpful -- and everyone spoke excellent English. Breakfast in the garden was magical. The birds flying around are perhaps a bit of a nuisance but totally add to the atmosphere. My son gorged on yogurt and ham and fresh fruit. They served him a beautiful cup of rich hot chocolate. Our coffee came with hot steamed milk. Our triple room was large enough, clean and bright, looking out on to the garden. Absolutely silent at night. Air conditioning was fine. And windows open so we had a choice of air or no air. We were in a family group of 10. My brother's family stayed in the "family room" which was not as pretty as ours -- the kids' room was small for 3 and a bit stale smelling. But asa family they had two rooms and two bathrooms in a suite which was great for the five of them. My parents' double( immediately below our triple) was very spacious (same as triple just without the cot) and decorated in a similarly elegant style. (Pretty typical of Venice from what I can see) My parents enjoyed a delightful dinner in the garden one night. And while they took all the grandkids on a gondola ride, we relaxed with spritz cocktails in that same quiet, cool, peaceful oasis. Upon arrival, a porter picked us up at the water taxi spot and led us through narrow alleyways to the hotel. Two porters helped schlep our bags back to the water taxi upon departure. The desk staff recommended restaurants, helped with directions, maps, phone calls, interenet etc. Always pleasant. The wifi was annoying because the time is limited and you have to plug in a code and log in and log out. But that seems to be the norm in italy. If I had the money I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers of Venice!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ehp_9
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Room was absolutely tiny , a cabin on a cruise ship is bigger than the room! Staff were extremely unfriendly , I overheard a guest telling reception that there was no toilet paper in his bathroom , the answer : look in the cupboards in the corridors and you might find some there!!!!!! I went to reception to check out at 8pm as we were leaving very early the next morning and was told that the accounts were closed for the night, I could check only check out after midnight as they had closed their books for the night! On the plus side the hotel is very charming and the outside area is very pretty but that far from made up for the awful room, which is microscopic , cramped , carpet was filthy, had a shower cap the first night and it was missing in action the next night , perhaps the room next door had run out of shower caps!!!!! Thank goodness I didn't order the Waldorf salad!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a luxury treat.”
Reviews.Author: amanda_eastwood
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from The Hotel Flora in Venice after spending a fabulous weekend away with 8 girlfriends to celebrate a 40th birthday. The hotel was traditionally Venitian with an amazingly tranquil courtyard, perfect for a glass of wine and breakfasting outside. The concierge was wonderful and we gave him our requirements and he booked our meals out ensuring we didnt get caught out by what can be a very expensive poor experience. He also reccomended and arranged our walking tour and trip to the Glass factory. Inevitably we had a gondola trip which was memorable though be prepared for a 100 euros bill per boat! We all would like to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: debay11
Reviews.Content: Had 2 days/1 night by myself, after a vacation in Italy with a girlfriend. Choose La Flora because of its great recommendations on numerous sites. Was not disappointed. I did get the tiny room, but I was by myself and did not mind. Knew I was getting it. No surprise. If you are with someone, get a larger room. People were great. Got a recommendation for dinner at a small place where the food and service could stand along side any 5 star. The hotel is in a great location. Felt safe both day and night. Hope to return with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: freckledsmile99
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here for over a week and what a great time we had! The Romanelli family and staff were friendly, helpful and steered us in the right direction when we asked them where to go and what to do. Giovanni and Stefano specifically were terrific. The courtyard where you have breakfast every morning and where we read our books on many an afternoon, is just lovely! I hight reccommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “classic”
Reviews.Author: 1st-timer2010
Reviews.Content: Great location, 5 minute walk to Piazza San Marco. Wonderful patio, surrounded by vine covered walls and fencing. Excellent place to chill at end of day. Typical european rooms styles. They hooked us up with reservation at a restaurant that said they had no availability at all for night we desired. Room was warm at night, as we were on top floor. Typical "feel good" thermostat control in room had no apparent impact. What I find common in Europe, by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: dollyQld
Reviews.Content: Absolutely charming,wonderful staff and perfect location. Rooms are olde world so don't expect a chain hotel experience. This is better

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: joe57
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and knew what to expect. For a hotel in Venice, I didn't expect large rooms and all the modern facilities. Look at the pictures at the hotel's site, it looks and feels like that in real life on location. We enjoyed the look and feel of an Venetian palazzo. And the friendly service. You will also like the central location close to everything in San Marco. Good beds to sleep well in. However, note the small bathrooms. Everything was clean and worked well. Our room faced the small alley leading to the hotel and some noice could be heard as the alley echoed voices. But after a day's walking I never woke up a night!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Flora helped me complete a "Decent Proposal"”
Reviews.Author: mzimmerman2
Reviews.Content: Venice was the centerpiece of a two week European vacation. It was in Venice that I was going to pose that matrimonial question and I had the image of how I wanted to orchestrate the evening, but I was going to need help with some details leading up to "the ask". The staff at Hotel Flora (Giovanni in particular) were just the perfect resource and they had no idea of my agenda. They just were doing their job as only they know how. "I need a romantic restaurant for the two of us this evening." "How Romantic?" "Very" "I have two choices, " he replied as he gave me a fairly detailed overview while showing me locations on the map. He dialed immediately to secure a reservation while we waite. The one I selected at his recommendation was spot-on perfect for a dinner of this significance. 4-Star Gourmet ++. Quiet. Out of the tourist traffic. Modern, yet warm and intimate. As we sat at a corner table, a jacketed waiter flicked his lighter to ignite a long candle taper on our table. And from that point on it was surprise after surprise. A young husband and wife own and operate the establishment. As a sommolier he matched a wine to our appetizers and entre' selections. Now the lone required component to this evening was a gondola ride where I could ask the question in a quiet Venetian canal. It's not peak tourist season so these gondoliers pack up early. The couple who owned the restaurant summoned a personal friend who is a gondolier, and he agreed to meet us at the restaurant; walk to his gondola and at 10:30pm at night we were the lone boat traffic in the canals near San Marco. It could not have been better scripted...until the gondolier dropped us off at the Hotel Daniele (See movie: The Tourist)...told us to buy one celebratory drink at the bar and just soak in the history and architecture of the lobby. As the piano player tickled the keys with a romantic ballad, our evening was complete and a success. It started with my friend Giovanni at Hotel Flora. We picked this hotel for these great features: we had access to use a health club next door...great perk when traveling two weeks without some fitness break (for us)...close to a water bus stop (key for luggage transporting through the streets...very close)...great breakfasts...historic rooms/cozy size/clean/all we needed to keep our bags, shower and sleep...quaint courtyard to sip a cocktail or glass of wine before dinner...great little bar and sitting room...computer access (fee...but reasonable)...centrally located to any sightseeing or shopping or dining you care to experience. Excellent hotel...professional staff. We will stay at this hotel the next time we return. They did a great job making us feel welcome and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, a little hard to find”
Reviews.Author: pilarkitty
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Flora. It's in a fabulous location, just a few blocks from Piazza San Marco. When we arrived in Venice, we got off at the wrong vaporetta stop and had to walk through Piazza San Marco. I logged on to the web site and it was a little hard to find based on the directions given by the hotel. If you stay there, make sure to print out a map so you know where you are going. It's next to the Bvlgari Store. We chose this hotel, because of the free wifi. We got so much more. The breakfast and bar staff was very friendly and remembered our drink orders from day to day. The courtyard was beautiful and really made you enjoy your breakfast experience. Breakfast (included) was very good. They even provided an additional menu if you wanted something more hearty. I never needed anything else than what was provided. The decor is very quaint and the rooms are expectedly small, but comfortable. The hotel could provide more comfortable bedding. I am a huge fan of the bedding at the Starwood and Marriott full service hotels.This bedding was sub par. They did provide nice duvets, but I could have used another pillow and a softer mattress. The only thing that bugged me about the hotel was that you kept having to ask for a code to access the internet. It was a slight inconvenience, and certainly did not ruin our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value in low season, typically Venitian”
Reviews.Author: wesaw66
Reviews.Content: A beautifully quaint hotel, very central. Staff were friendly and spoke English. The real treat was being able to have a substantial breakfast deliveried to our room, with no extra cost. Room was beautifully decorated and olde worldy. I would recommend in low season as prices are a bit steep in the Summer.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Weekend”
Reviews.Author: birthdaytravel
Reviews.Content: Fabulous weekend which had been long awaited and the Hotel Flora was a great choice which helped make the weekend live up to high expectations of Venice. Great location with everything you could want on the doorstep. Great Room that was quiet and overlooked the garden at the side and back. Friendly, cheerful and helpful staff. Good breakfasts to set us up for all the walking required when in Venice. it was lovely to stay in an old traditional environment with all comfort provided for. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great location...great service”
Reviews.Author: wanderingtraveler60
Reviews.Content: Solo traveler, stayed 4 days - all was ok, expect some noise -- don't know where you can escape noise -- but -- not bad..great service -- for the value of 80 euros a nite -- excellent deal...

Reviews.Title: “A TRUE VENETIAN GEM”
Reviews.Author: 190813Sandy
Reviews.Content: A small hotel hidden away amongst the designer shops close to San Marco, within sight of the San Moise Bridge.The inclusive continental breakfast was generous, with a cooked option offered if preferred either served in the garden, lounge or your room. The hotel bar and lovely garden were a perfect base to return to during the day or evening. The staff wthere incredible and could not have been anymore helpful. The room was very comfortable and clean.....what a gem !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: sst03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Flora after reading reviews on this web-site as well as a recommendation from Rick Steve's. We got a great rate because it's off season - 125 Euro/night. I mistakenly booked at "triple" room thinking that it would be bigger but it was in fact a room for 3 people - oh well. Anyway, it worked to my favor because we ended up getting 2 rooms - one with 1 bed and another with a twin bed so it was kind of like we had our own "wing" of the hotel - rooms 41 and 42. The bed was fabulous and we both slept great. The desk agent on the morning shift was the sweetest man ever (his evening colleague not so much). Details: shower is small but amazing water pressure, everything else is pretty standard. Remember, they don't use top sheets in Europe (they're the best sheets in the world!) - just down comforters - no big deal just thought I'd mention it. The location of the hotel is not too far from the San Marco vaporetto stop. As a side note, wear flat shoes as it's easier to navigate on the cobbled streets and up and down the little bridges over the canal. The breakfast, included in our stay, was really yummy - you can select what you want and have it delivered to your room (they phone you about 5 mintues before they come up) or you can eat downstairs in their little cafe. I had coissants and yogurt each morning. I brought my own assortment of tea bags from home which made it special. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: TravlFam
Reviews.Content: We were in Venice for a quick, 3 night getaway during the end of Carnival. Hotel Flora was a fantastic find! The location is superb, in the posh shopping area just two short blocks from San Marco. It is easy to miss the hotel as it is tucked inside a little walkway between an art gallery and a designer store. Once you enter the hotel, you enter an oasis of peace and quiet . Our booking had us in a standard room for two nights and final night in a deluxe room. Hotel staff made us feel welcome and cherished us as guests. We were in a standard room for the first two nights and the last night had a deluxe room reservation. The standard room was small but comfortable with very high ceilings and a beautiful Murano chandelier. We slept blissfully and refreshed to tackle each day of crazy Carnival. Our final night, in room 3, a deluxe room was fantastic. The room is featured in their brochure and frankly, I believe they must have upgraded us to a suite. What a perfect way to end a getaway. Breakfast was lovely. Plenty to choose from. Cappuccini and hot chocolates were delicious! A perfect little hotel with all the charm of Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better - fantastic apartment, central position, friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: wendypenrose2002
Reviews.Content: We were offered a two bed apartment in the building next to the hotel which was perfect for our family with kids age 7 and 10. It gave us extra space and even a roof terrace but with the benefit of being able to enjoy a generous breakfast at the very friendly and cosy hotel next door. All this and so close to St Mark's square too. We took a private water taxi from the airport and they dropped us a very short walk from the hotel. Carnival was on and the kids had made their own masks to wear which they really enjoyed. We were offered a free return trip to Murano to see glass making which was fun. The only draw back is that it is very expensive to eat out with the family and with fussy eaters this can be tricky. We ate a lot of pizza! It would have been ideal if there was a small kitchenette int he appartment to allow us to at least make sandwiches for lunch. The service at the hotel was excellent. The kids were very well looked after too - they even gave them a typical venetian carnival pastry for free.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: michgile
Reviews.Content: For the weekend in Venice me and my wife decided to stay in Flora hotel. And we were not disappointed. A small nice hotel in the very center of this beautiful city ( about 5-7 minutes from San Marco square). Our room was rather small, but really important that it was clean and nice. The same with the bathroom. The hotel got the most beautiful courtyard I ever seen. Full of green, with the antique statues. It was a great pleasure to drink a cup of coffee there. It's a pity it was a bit cold - we visited Venice in February, but if you will be there during the warm time, I suppose this courtyard is perfect to have a breakfast or a late after dinner drink. The Flora stuff was really friendly, happy to give an advise if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Timcor061
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay. The staff, location and breakfest were great. The rooms are a little small as one would expect in Venice and the AC could be improved in some of the rooms. nevertheless it is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “pefect little hotel near everything”
Reviews.Author: RomeHome
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and stay here every time I can when I come to Milano. You can't go wrong: it's close to Piazza San Marco and thus, everything else. The rooms are small, and there is no restaurant, but you're not here to spend all your time in your room, much less eating at a hotel restaurant. If you can get in, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Aussie12Syd
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the hotel's website based on other travellers reviews and we were amazed at the value of this well located hotel. The staff at reception and in the breakfast room were exceptionally friendly and went out of their way to assist us with making our stay comfortable. The room we were allocated (3 adults) was comfortable and spacious and looked on to a gorgeous private courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, beautiful and amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: butterflysurrey
Reviews.Content: Hotel Flora is just so wonderful, we stayed for 2 nights 14th-15th Jan. The location is just perfect for sight seeing and the room we had was so beautiful and soooooooo clean! Breakfast is very nice with lots of choice. The staff cant do enough for you and are so friendly we felt looked after from the moment we walked into the hotel until the moment we booked out. We will go back to Hotel Flora next year and would say to anyone this hotel is worth visiting. Thank you so much Hotel Flora for making our stay in Venice so special.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ccmacy
Reviews.Content: We just checked out of the Hotel Flora and I am compelled to write this review. The location is perfect- within walking distance to all the sights of Venice. The staff are so friendly and accommodating,especially Sergio. The linens are soft and of high quality and the rooms are immaculate. The beds are firm and comfortable. This is a great place for families as they have rooms to accommodate you. Their dinner recommendations were phenomenal and they made reservations for us with no difficulty. Breakfast was fresh and high quality.The garden was gorgeous even in Winter. We did not want to leave it was such a great experience. I recommend this as the best hotel option in all of Venice! You will not be disappointed! Thank you Hotel Flora for a fabulous experience!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: SummerTravelerx4
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved this hotel. The staff were friendly and the place was beautiful and clean. Meals were served outside on the charming patio. Food was fresh and there was a good variety of options as well. Relaxing, comfortable, and very family friendly. Location is great! Within walking distance to everything in Venice. We were there in July and never felt crowded or had to wait for any service. Also a great value for our money. We will definitely be returning to this hotel some day.

Reviews.Title: “Search no more...This is where you should spend your Venice vacation.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuzz93
Reviews.Content: Flora is a charming hotel tucked away in a quiet alley. The front desk manager was MOST helpful...provided excellent restaurant recommendations with specific directions, arranged a taxi to Murano and the airport, and even helped us exchange email documents with our real estate agent in the US to sell our house. We enjoyed our breakfast in the courtyard each morning, but don't leave your plate unattended. The birds love the buffet, too! We hope to return to Hotel Flora soon.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly situated, breakfast in lovely courtyard”
Reviews.Author: LuKn
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Flora is just the perfect basis for a relaxed venice vacation. it s next to the opera in the heart of the city, and yet you are in complete calm and peace. they have a lovely court yard where breakfast is served - this you will share with dozens of lovely sparrows waiting to be fed... good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in Venice, would definitely stay there again when in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: rc51cgy
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Flora based on Trip Advisor reviews and on the emails we got back from them when querying for room availability. Very happy with our booking and stay at this wonderful little hotel. Staff was great. Excellent recommendations for dinner/lunch. Check-in was the fastest I've ever done and we've stayed at alot of hotels on business and leisure. I think within 5 min we were checked in and on our way to our room. Courtyard is wonderful and morning breakfast is quite adequate and service was top notch. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: GoingBacktoItaly
Reviews.Content: LOVED this hotel - we spent a month in Italy, and this was my favorite hotel. Elegant lobby and room; friendly, helpful service; great location, great breakfasts with fresh, warm pastries. If return to Venice, will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: cj0517
Reviews.Content: Friendly service in a good location in Venice. The hotel is moerately priced. Rooms are not large but comfortable. Nice courtyard for breakfast. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with old world charm”
Reviews.Author: TravelEatRepeat
Reviews.Content: Walking through the courtyard of the Hotel Flora feels like walking back in time. The exterior of the hotel looks like it's several hundred years old and really made us feel like we were in a different place. The rooms are similarly charming with fabric wall coverings and a glass chandelier. Bed is large, linens clean, and the bathroom has modern amenities. There is a tiny safe in the wardrobe, big enough for a wallet or some cash, but it has a skeleton type key that must be left with the front desk when leaving. Would be nice to have a larger safe with electronic lock. No iron or pants press in room. The morning staff, especially Sergio the desk clerk, were gregarious, helpful and charming. The afternoon and evening staff weren't quite as charming but still friendly and helpful. Breakfast is included with the room rate and includes coffee, breads, jams, cheese slices, boiled eggs, yogurt and cereal. This is the one weak spot of this hotel, but it's something to get the morning moving. Location is good. 5 minute walk from San Marco and vaporetto stops on lines 1,2 and airport lines red, blue and gold.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Krenian
Reviews.Content: Hotel Flora was an excellent experience for us. The location is perfect yet quiet. The staff is extremely friendly and the food was excellent. We were there with 2 teenagers and while the bedrooms were small, they were very comfortable and clean. We travel a great deal and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: lovesworldtravel88
Reviews.Content: Wow hotel Flora was incredible! Staff was amazing Breakfast was great - with delicious cappuccinos Rooms were Victorian style - felt like we were back in time (but in a good way)-they modernized the hotel and it was so beautiful All in all had a great stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed with my experience-would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Lucythepug
Reviews.Content: Venice was the last stop on our honeymoon and we were looking forward to staying at Hotel Flora. We paid 300Euros to stay here in a Deluxe Room. We checked in early, around 9am and the room was not ready (totally understandable) so we left our luggage and returned at noon. When we came back, we went up to our room and the person and the front desk our luggage would be right up. 20 minutes later, my husband and I are in our room and without even knocking, the bellman guy opens the door without any notice. Thank goodness we weren't doing anything private. The room was ok, but the bathroom was ridden with mold. There was mold all over the ceiling and in the creases long the wall. The toilet seat was full out broken, but was on there to look as if nothing was wrong. We put a ton of items in the safe. When we left the hotel, the man at the desk insisted we leave our room and safe key at the front desk. I know that his is typically normal--and is an OPTION for guests, but he insisted and when we told him that we preferred to hold it, he told us this would be a big problem. ? He was rude and told us that if we lost our keys, there are no replacements. We took that chance. When we checked out, the owner was rude as well. The breakfast area was lovely to look at, but once you sit down and eat there, birds are not afraid to fly around you and pick at your food. The hotel is in a good location, thats about it.

Reviews.Title: “hotel flora - good value”
Reviews.Author: adiosamiga
Reviews.Content: we choose to say off the grand canal due to comments on noise and price. hotel flora was good choice. breakfast lncluded. good room but not luxurious. clean and staff was as accommodating as any. good location. air conditioned.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Flora”
Reviews.Author: brosen50
Reviews.Content: Five minutes from St. Mark's Square, this inviting hotel was our home for 5 nights. We had a family suite, 2 small separate rooms which accommodated myself, my wife and 2 kids-21 and 16. Warm and friendly staff, great breakfasts in an open courtyard. Excellent service, good advise, and willing assistance. Reasonably priced, don't miss this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, wonderful hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: soldan66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is hidden away in a side alley, 5min walk from St. Marko square. There is a beautiful inner garden for breakfast, typical venetian rooms (we had the 3 bed room we window to the garden, for a couple with 1 child it's perfect). The hotel staff are extremly friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay”
Reviews.Author: dlitz224
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel Flora, friendly, warm and very accommodating. Definitely would stay here again. .Have the hotel make a reservation to have the water taxi pick you up at the airport....saves time and energy (dragging suitcases from the bus-boat to the hotel is exhausting!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “A Long Lovely Stay at Hotel Flora”
Reviews.Author: Wanderful77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Flora last month for 10 days as a solo traveler, and the hotel and its staff helped make my trip something I will always fondly remember. My room, while small, was a perfect fit for me, and was, most importantly, very, very quiet. The staff was uniformly courteous and helpful, and the gentleman who orchestrated the charming breakfast room was an absolute gem, unfailingly cheerful and on the spot every time, often even before I asked for something. He remembered every morning that I wanted my cappuccino without their customary sprinkling of chocolate and would call out to have it ready even before I had fully entered the breakfast room. The breakfast was ample and appetizing, with croissants, fresh cut fruit, cereals, juices, everything you would want or need to begin your day. The location is ideal, tucked down an alleyway, just off a fashionable calle, across from the excellent (and highly recommended) La Caravella restaurant, and near enough to Piazza San Marco and its vaporetto stop without being too close to the mayhem of either one. If I should ever be lucky enough to return to Venice, I will return to Hotel Flora.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: bethalewallen
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in Hotel Flora, and loved it. Though I prefer more modern room decorations, the room was very comfortable and the staff was helpful at any hour I needed assistance. Don't miss the garden - eating or drinking there will cost you quite a bit but the relaxing experience is worth it. The hotel is in an excellent location that provides a much-needed calm - you'll breathe a sigh of relief every time you turn down the quiet walkway. My only complaint was that the hotel charged for internet access on the shared computer - the only hotel I had in Italy to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate hotel with amazing service”
Reviews.Author: LLL69
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel in the heart of Venice. Tucked back off one of the main streets leading to St. Mark's square, this is a charming hotel with fantastic staff who really take care of you. Breakfast is included and was great...especially sitting in the courtyard. I had a single room which was small by north american standards, but it made up for it in character and style. Anyone looking for an intimate boutique hotel in an excellent location with top-notch service will enjoy Hotel Flora!

Reviews.Title: “Slept like a log in a tiny, beautiful room.”
Reviews.Author: psk219
Reviews.Content: Hotel Flora is an upscale hotel hidden on an upscale street in Venice. It is beautiful! Every detail of the place has been thought about and examined to make it extremely clean, remodeled with excellent service. The single room I ventured into was the tiniest room I've ever stayed in...yet the bathroom, also very small, had the cleanest tile work, grout and toilet I've seen in three months of travel. The wallpaper, furniture and bed were all A+ and the scenery out my little window was of the garden. The garden is a place where breakfast is served each morning for the guests. It is absolutely beautiful, complete with robins resting on the fountain and on table tops. It was a serene and lovely place to rest after hectic sightseeing in Venice. Breakfast is included in the price of the room. Tables are set very elegantly with beautiful fabric for tablecloths with excellent, professional and polite waiters. Everyone who works at this small, boutique hotel is service oriented. As a tall, bigger person, I thought the room was extremely small but it didn't matter once I made it my own. Everything worked perfectly from drains to tv to the comfort of the mattress. I'll go back again and again. It was worth every euro!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, gracious staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: lcollens
Reviews.Content: Hotels in venice are expensive for the most part but the staff at this hotel are extremely helpful and knowledgeable of things in the area to do and how to get there. The how to getbthere is important in the labrinyth that is Venice. The rooms are smallish but pack a lot of stuff in there. Very near to San Marco, Harrys Bar, Hard Rock Cafe and about 5 minutes walk from Rialto (once you know where you're going). I went with my girlfriend and we slept through the breakfast but I have heard good things about it from other guests. I would stay here again. It can be a little hard to find as it is off a shopping street down an alley.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: _Le_nochka_F
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Flora for 4 nights. The location is very good- close to St.Marco. It is not my first time in Venice, so I was aware of the local pecularities. In Venice you can't expect spacy high-tech rooms, it is not about it! I mention it, because I have read the reviews that complain that rooms are tiny (especially american tourists, who are used to different standards). Inner patio is absolutely beautiful, a consolation for those tired from hustle and bustle of big cities! Our room was small indeed (not tiny though in comparison to places like Paris :) ), but charming and clean. Bathroom was tiny, but we were fine with it as we know what to expect. For the overweight people it can be a problem though. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, the receptionist's restaurant recommendation (followed by a reservation) was exceptionally good. The best food and service that I ever had in Venice! Breakfast could be better (ham was missing), but was was still fine. Overall, I would recommend to stay in Flora. It is charming and well located.

Reviews.Title: “It is a gem.”
Reviews.Author: nomenemo
Reviews.Content: So many people I know told me to stay here and I wasn't disappointed. Yes, the room we had was small, and the bathroom teeny (hint: don't drop the soap in the shower because if you're over 7 years old you won't be able to bend down to pick it up!). But the rooms are nicely appointed in a sort of slightly shabby old Venetian style. Best, the staff is wonderful--couldn't be warmer or more helpful--and the location can't be beat. You're about two blocks from Piazza San Marco and in the midst of the best shopping (i.e., most expensive) in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A haven in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tonto2304
Reviews.Content: Recommended by a friend with very good taste, this hotel did not disappoint in any way. The green and tranquil courtyard provides a memorable start to each day over breakfast (usually 'shared' with hungry sparrows!) and a perfect setting for evening cocktails or candle-lit light supper. Our room for three was small but perfectly adequate and, more importantly, clean, with a good bathroom and shower. We were particularly grateful to the concierge for three marvellous recommendations for supper places - all different, off the beaten track, and good value for money. Top marks!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: PackingQueen
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel, in a very handy location literally 3 minutes walk from Basilica San Marco. Helpful staff, lovely rooms. Bathrooms too small, but this was a minor thing.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Listen To Rick Steves - One Of The Worst Hotels I Ever Stayed At!”
Reviews.Author: peterworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m not one to do this, but against my better judgment, I took Rick Stevesâ€™ recommendation and booked a room at Hotel Flora. I arrived-after a long search to find the hotel which is located down a narrow dead-end kind of street-in the morning, and my room was not ready. Ok, fine, understood. Upon check in the front desk clerk asked for my passport, wrote down the information in it, and then insisted on keeping it until my room was ready, which made me really uncomfortable. I didn't then and still don't understand why, but I reluctantly agreed and left it with him. A few hours later, I returned and was given keys (yes keys) and shown to my room. First off, the key chain had a heavy door knocker attached that weighed about 3 lbs., and I'm not exaggerating here. Since my backpack was heavy already, I immediately removed this from the chain. Attached also, was a skeleton key for the safe (later on that). As soon as I opened the door to my room, I was unhappy. The room was very tiny-the bed almost ended at the bathroom door-and the decor was really in need of an update. I felt like I was in some weird cabin in the woods rather than in Venice, Italy. There were dark wooden shelves on both sides of the beds for your clothes, covered by a gold somewhat musty curtain. The shower was another story. The only way I can describe it is "small space capsule". If you've ever had a closed MRI youâ€™d know what I mean. I felt like I was standing in a pizza oven. I kept thinking that a large person could never shower in that room because as slim as I am I was having a difficult time moving around. Next, the safe. You could fit a wallet in it, and nothing else. The lock chamber on the back of the door to the safe was so thick it took up most of the space! I was always squeezing things in there and still had to carry the rest with me since there was never any room. Honestly, it was the tiniest safe I've ever seen. The only thing that was big was the key to it! When I returned to the lobby I asked if I could upgrade to a bigger/nicer room and very politely expressed my dislike for my current accommodations. I was told nothing was or would become available. I was perfectly willing to pay for a room like the one shown on the website-which by the way is the only one like it, I think, and the answer was no.
