I honestly think itâ€™s because I was traveling alone and they wanted/needed one of those rooms for two people. I saw many room keys dangling from the shelf behind the clerk at the reception desk, but my key was noticeably vacant because my room was occupied!! I settled for my fate and since it was only two days I thought I could live with it, but when I thought of the rate I paid, I was even more upset. This little single room cost me nearly 320 Euros (nearly $500 USD) and wasnâ€™t worth that at all. Two days later I stayed in a beautiful hotel in Florence for two nights that cost $252 Euros ($354) and had a room twice the size and breakfast fit for a king (later on that great review). Now breakfast. It was included, but thanks for nothing. It was the cheapest continental breakfast I've ever seen. Usually in Europe continental breakfast will include lunch meats, cheeses and scrambled eggs. None of this here, but they did have a small dish of hard-boiled eggs, so I do have to mention that. There's an outside garden but I sat inside, and there were birds flying inside and perching on the cereal dispensers eating the droppings people left behind. They were probably the only happy ones. That was really disgusting-not to mention unhealthy-and no one said a word or did anything. I mentioned Rick Stevesâ€™ recommendation again at checkout time because according to his book youâ€™ll get a 20% discount for doing so. Completely untrue! When I asked, I was told that I already had the lowest discount, so no. Meanwhile, this was the regular price so I donâ€™t know what discount they were talking about. I paid the more for this hotel than any other in Italy, and yet I liked it less than any other! Every time I headed back to the hotel I dreaded going there and I never felt like it was an extension of my home or had a warm and nice feeling when I was there. I traveled this time without a laptop so the only positive thing I have to say is that they charge only 3 Euros for Â½ hour, but considering Milan and Florence offered free internet, again, really, thanks for nothing! Please do your research and look for a better hotel. During my last trip to Venice I stayed at The Saturnia, which oddly enough is located directly across from Hotel Flora. I even considered just going there and biting the bullet, but since I felt ripped off already, I stayed. No matter how the The Romanelli family responds here, this is my true experience!

Reviews.Title: “Still a gem!”
Reviews.Author: elainesl
Reviews.Content: The following is from an email that I sent to the hotel earlier this week: I am eager to express my appreciation and delight at the wonderful stay we recently had at your hotel. I had stayed at the hotel a number of years ago, and, with the passage of time, I wasnâ€™t sure if the hotel would still be the right choice for me and my travel companion who was visiting Venice for the first time. We were both very happy with the Flora. Our superior double room was large and comfortable. The breakfast buffet provided a good start on each busy day, and the coffee was excellent (not always the case with hotel coffee.) The hotelâ€™s location, of course, could not be more convenient. But what really distinguishes the Flora is the level of service we received, from the waiters in the breakfast room, to the porters, to the front desk staff. I would challenge more expensive hotels to display the same level of warmth, service and courtesy that we found at the Flora. I assure you I will always recommend the Flora, and look forward to more visits in the future. As further comment to the above endorsement, I will add that the hotel offers a small computer access off the lobby (there is a nominal charge per half hour) though it's not particularly comfortable. I also haven't stayed in hot weather so I can't comment regarding air conditioning. Room decor was pleasant, and in good condition, though dated. These were minor issues relative to our overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “A total haven”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLuckyDog
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, courtyard is out of a romance novel, lovely breakfast, perfect location (central but hidden), great staff. Tiny bathroom, but it serves the purpose. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Travelling33
Reviews.Content: Hotel Flora was great. I was there for a week, and could have stayed another week, easy. I had probably the smallest room in the hotel, room 35. A single room, it was just big enough for a twin bed, wardrobe, and desk. My bathroom was slightly larger than others' in my group, and had a separate window, so that made up for the small room. Very clean and comfortable. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful with transportation questions that I had. The breakfast, and Stephano, were wonderful. It was hard each morning to decide what to have for breakfast. Egg, croissant, yogurt, fruit, so many choices. I also recommend arranging to have dinner at the hotel. The bartender cooks a limited number of dinners each evening and while slightly more expensive than you might pay elsewhere, the food was wonderful. It was warm outside and we were able to eat in the garden. It felt like eating in your own backyard. Wonderful. The location is very convenient. Just a few minutes to Piazza San Marco, vaporetto station, and a pleasant walk everywhere else. We had vaporetto passes for the week, but actually walked most places, including to the Rialto, and back from dinner close to ferrovia.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Flora is a little jewel in a magical city.”
Reviews.Author: richchar
Reviews.Content: Venice was the last destination of a 9 day trip; we were celebrating a milestone birthday and semi-retirement , so we wanted to mark the occasions with something special. Many people, with a wide range of travel experiences and tastes, recommended Hotel Flora as just that - something special. Based on reviews in TripAdvisor, we reserved a deluxe double overlooking the garden .... a wise choice. We hoped for the best, but based on written reviews we steeled ourselves for cramped quarters and uneven experience. In fact, Hotel Flora exceeded our expectations. Everything about it is unique and wonderful. The location is phenomenal - a short walk from the Grand Canal and St. Mark's Square, yet set back in a remarkably quiet and peaceful setting. This boutique hotel oozes warmth, welcoming charm and old-world elegance: the beautifully appointed lobby, the magnificent garden, the gracious staff. The room itself (#15) was fabulous: large, beautiful, clean, quiet, with a serene view of the garden. It became a haven when we needed a break from other tourists and sight-seeing. The staff were wonderfully helpful, while respecting privacy and space. We are already planning a return visit to this magical city, and this jewel of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff, terrific breakfast, fantastic courtyard”
Reviews.Author: pauljuliuspeter
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, just down the way from San Marco, terrific staff, Internet was a bit awkward (common room), room was small but clean, crisp, quiet, and more than adequate, breakfast lasted me the day, and the courtyard was like an park, what a way to start the day. We loved it. I believe it is a three star only because the rooms are a bit small (we were in Venice, not interested in spending a ANY time in the room.) - Paul

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trekker13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights here and enjoyed the location and ambience of this great little hotel. Hotel Flora is just a few minutes walk from St. Mark's but its location at the end of a quite alley and its beautiful courtyard allowed us to feel a million miles away from the crowds. The staff was especially helpful and the rooms were beautifully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location! Excellent service! A great place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Luv2trvl27
Reviews.Content: My husband, mother and myself stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Flora. We initially chose the hotel for its proximity to St. Mark's Square. We reserved a family suite which gave us 2 separate private bedroom areas and 2 bathrooms. The rooms, while small, were absolutely adequate for what we needed them for..... sleeping!!! Since we only had 3 days, we spent very little time in the room and explored the city. The breakfast in the a.m. was wonderfully done and the staff were very attentive to our needs. The front desk staff were also incredibly helpful and friendly. If going back to Venice, I would not even bother to look for a different hotel! Thanks Hotel Flora for helping us to feel so welcome in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in an elegant street, near Piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: flanar
Reviews.Content: I had already been in Venice twice; my mother too, but it was my two daughters (10 and 13th) first time. My mother is 80th and needs some help to walk. I was looking for a hotel well located, near Piazza San Marco and found Hotel Flora. By the time we arrived, we liked the decoration, the atmosphere... It is side by side with Bulgari and steps from lots of nice shops, like Gucci, Fendi, Etro, Botega Veneta, etc... Walking to the other direction there are lots of art galleries. Breakfast is served in a patio with lots of plants and there is a CafÃ¨ or bar at the entrance of the hotel where we can get a capuccino or any other drink all day long. They serve even a light meal: the day we check out we had lunch there, a nice salad and a pasta (very good). The staff was very nice, everybody can feel like an abituÃ¨ but they are not invasive.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Oasis in a Hectic City!”
Reviews.Author: Travel4ever84
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Flora directly through their website--and were not disppointed. It is a splendid little hotel in a perfect location. We were on an extended trip to Venice, Paris and London starting in Venice. Venice is a special city--granted it is very crowded and expensive-but the Hotel Flora in our opinion was a good value at 200 euros a night for a deluxe double room. The staff are very accomodating and helpful. We did not arrive until about 6 PM after a long day of trvelling. We checked in quickly and got to the room-beaufifully furnished in antiques. The rooms are small--but that is genererally true in Europe. We did find it very comfortable. The garden is a hidden oasis of tranquility in a very hectic city. Breakfast was served every morning--buffet with croisants, rolls, cereal, fruit, yogurt, and eggs. Also juice and coffee--iIloved having a capaucinno every morning!This is included in the room rate. If you want for addtional cost they will provide a cooked breakfast. Service was excellent--We didn't even have to ask for the coffee after the first morning--there he was with coffee and juice. We loved returning to this quiet oasis after each day of sightseeing. One afternoon we had some coffee and cookies in the lounge. Service is excellent and the hotel is quaint and romantic. As an example one night we had a special dinner where my wife go a beautiful rose boquet. We were not sure what do do with it--the roses were in the sink. The next day when we returned to the room the maid had left a vase to put them in! The location is only a 5-10 minute walk to Piazza San Marco-but is quiet and down a short narrow little Calle.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ask front desk to recommend restaurant”
Reviews.Author: SAtraveler63
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, but expensive -- 150 Euros for one night. Beer was 5 Euros ($7.50) each for bottled beer. The rooms were nice with antique furniture, but key to room safe was on room key ring that you turn in to front desk before leaving hotel. Yeah, right!! What is wrong with electronic safes that you set your own code in? Hotel did have a restaurant but it was Sunday and the chef was "off." As you can see from title, we made a big mistake. Buy and use a travel book (like Frommer's). We had the book and then went to the restaurant recommended by the front desk. We sawseveral other hotel gusts there. Bad mistake. The dinner for my wife and me was 95 Euros -- one wine, salad Caprese and "fresh sea bass" at 30 Euros per plate. Well, Venice has 20 million visitors per year, and they try, and in our case succeeded, in gouging every one. On our next trip we will stay in Verona or Padua and day trip to Venice. Or, catch the cruise ship with a 30 minute train ride to Venice docks. We did spend the money to take a gondola ride. Their license fees to operate a gondola are about 250,000 Euros and the gondola costs about 200,000 Euros, so there is at least some reason for the $300 charge for a 45 minute trip. Well, we have done that. $700 for 24 hours in Venice is not quite Europe on $10 per day. We wish you better luck. Oh, did I forget to mention that 10 million tourists were in town the day we were there? RM

Reviews.Title: “Great place, can't beat the location.”
Reviews.Author: SB4SD
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Italy and stayed at the Hotel Flora for two nights with our family. The rooms were a bit tight, but still comfortable. The location is wonderful but still away from the crowds with no noise at night which was great. The breakfast in their garden is outstanding. We took a boat that they offered to Murano Island which was nice, BUT beware of the pushy sales people once you arrive!

Reviews.Title: “What terrific staff!”
Reviews.Author: sydsmom10
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took our first vacation to Italy and stayed at Flora for 3 nights. It is in a great area, very clean and comfortable. It is the staff that adds the real value to this Hotel. They are accomodating, professional and work very hard to please. Would recommend!! Thank you Hotel Flora!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Flora”
Reviews.Author: Mama_Duck_Tours
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem in Venice. It is very walkable from the San Marco Diretto stop. The hotel staff are most helpful and will book concerts, etc. The rooms are large by Italian standards (we had a triple) and well appointed. The garden is a great spot for a drink after a long day of site seeing. The breakfast room is very nice and a decent buffet breakfast is served. Wonderful ambiance and hospitality at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous breakfast at the hotel Flora”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel in the large corner room with a magical view on a next door palazzo garden and sculptures. This is a very charming hotel, with kind and welcoming staff and, as noted by many many others, a very lovely garden. The garden, which is really an oasis of verdant loveliness in a particularly bustling and touristy area of Venice is a great spot for reading the paper, having a drink or...a fabulous buffet breakfast which includes expresso or cappucino or hot chocolates (highly praised by the jr set). Our room was comfortable with lovely fixtures (see picture).

Reviews.Title: “Small by any standards”
Reviews.Author: RobReno
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be close to St. Marks Square, and knew the room would be small, but "two cats couldn't dance" in this room. Bathroom was even smaller. Felt like I had to open window to turn around. They also have the smallest bar Iâ€™ve ever seen. We did open the window, and door, and window in hall to try to cool things off. Then we had to worry about mosquitoes. Hotel was in nice location, and had a good breakfast in the courtyard. We were out of there in one day.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: OxfordRose
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my second visit to the Hotel Flora. As so many others have said, it is a gem of a hotel. The staff take their work very seriously, but are also friendly and welcoming. My previous trip was with our two young children, the one just finished with my elderly mother. All were treated with great warmth. If the Hotel Flora is full, try the Novecento, which is run by the same family, with simlar warmth and efficiency.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Bliss”
Reviews.Author: JEY08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had decided to get married in Venice and when looking for accommodation for the wedding party we came across the Hotel Flora. From the moment we enquired about availability to the when we arrived and then departed, everything and everyone was handled perfectly and with a smile. The entrance to the hotel is tucked away down a narrow path and enchanting when you walk in. The courtyard is wonderful to relax in and have your breakfast or a late afternoon G&T in. The rooms are not the biggest, size to be expected in Venice, but they are decorated and furnished brilliantly with a window overlooking the wonderfully green courtyard and completely in the Venetian style. We did not spend to much time in the room as we were sorting out the wedding and then meeting family and friends but we were looked after brilliantly. The breakfast experience is wonderful way to start the morning and the hotel recommended great restaurants for lunch and dinner. A complimentary bottle of champagne the night before the wedding, an easy change of rooms on the day of the wedding along with the waiters guaranteeing that the rain would stop before the ceremony (which it did thankfully) made it a stay to remember and thoroughly enjoyed. Definitely a recommended if your are going to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Our most favourite hotel of any we've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: burr66
Reviews.Content: From the moment we turned into the narrow opening between buildings on a main street and first saw the Hotel Flora we were in love with this hotel. It only got better from that moment 'til we had to say goodbye. The hotel is located an easy five minute walk from San Marco Square and the same from the Grand Canal where water transportation to just about anywhere is located. For those who worry about getting to the airport, a ten minute walk to water transportation that takes you right to the airport for 17 Eur or a direct boat for 25 Eur. Quick, easy and reasonable. The hotel's rooms are clean with all modern amenities. The common areas, like the tiny, two-stool bar, the lounge and separate dining rooms are quaint beyond telling where my wife and friend would sit over tea before calling it a day. For me and my wife's friend's husband, it was always outside in the hotel's incredibly beautiful courtyard over a glass of very good local wine. While we all fell in love with Venice, the courtyard of the Hotel Flora was my favourite place to relax and unwind. I can't say enough about the staff at this hotel. Friendly and warm with always a ready smile. The service level was some of the best I've ever experienced and all of the staff were helpful and informative. Without being intrusive, they were always there when needed and seemed to anticipate our every need. For all four of us, it was a sad morning when we had to leave for our trip home and we can't wait to return for there's not another hotel in all of Venice we'd stay at other than the Hotel Flora.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out for Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jim_in_Virginia
Reviews.Content: The Flora has much going for it. It is a short walk to San Marco Square, very convenient to shopping, the Grand Canal, and numerous great restaurants. It has an excellent full breakfast, and a very charming garden courtyard, where we enjoyed drinks from the bar. The front desk staff were very helpful in recommending some very good restaurants, and the bar tender has a photographic memory for drink orders. The room was clean. BUT, beware of room size. We asked for the largest room available and got one with barely enough room for a queen-size bed, armoire, chair, and tiny table for tiny TV. The shower in the bathroom was so small that the door popped open if you bent over. You couldn't open the armoire doors all the way since the bed was in the way. It took some advance logistic planning for two of us to maneuver around at the same time. That said, we weren't in Venice to spend a lot of time in the room. It was clean and comfortable, very conveniently located, very charming, and not overly pricey for its location. So, with the warning to make sure you don't get one of the closet rooms, this is a keeper, and we would definitely return another time.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: AlbaLima
Reviews.Content: I was travelling in Italy with my two daughters to see family and see many of the beautiful things Italy had to offer. We arrived at the Hotel Flora and fell in love. The staff were tremendous and helped us with any questions. We loved our room which was very spacious and had a beautiful Murano chandelier. The bathroom was wonderful as well. We loved breakfast in the morning and made great friends with the waiter there Stefano Bonn. I would go back there again and stay longer. The hot chocolate in the morning is a must. The beautiful garden area is just magical. It is lovely to sit there in the late afternoon and have a campari & soda. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: dumdidum
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our new years eve trip to venice staying 3 nights at the flora. There have to be very nice rooms in the hotel but we definitely did not get one although we booked two month in advance. The room was tiny and had no correspondence with the pictures available on the web. Only the bed was (maybe) antique but e.g. the cupboard was pretty ugly. The bathroom was tiny but very clean and is probably acceptable for such an old house. Furthermore the walls were thin such that one would wake up early. For 260 euro per night the room was very disappointing which we were complaining about at the reception without effect. The breakfast was good and the breakfast service very charming. If you go there make sure that you get what is advertised on the net because the staff at the reception desk will not care about your complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: KashifMarvi
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 2 nights at Flora Hotel, Venice. The rooms were spacious and cozy, the staff were very friendly, the facilities were perfect. Since I travel the whole world around, sometimes there are very little littel things whcih matters most to me, and Flora had all those things to make my trip to Venice a perfect trip. I must admit that out of all my travels, Flora was the only hotel where on checking out, I had to specificaly ask for the Owner of the hotel and thanked him personally for the wonderful hospitability extended by the management during my stay. I would absolutely recommend it to anyone who is travelling to Venice, and specially for those who are travelling to Venice for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel tucked away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: abc583
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend in Venice, staying in Hotel Flora after reading the TA reviews. The location of the hotel is perfect, in a lane off Venices most chic shopping street, 5 mins walk from St Mark's and the nearest water bus stop. Staff were friendly, and helpful. The room was small but the bed was very comfortable and the linen excellent. The bathroom was the smallest I've ever seen! But we were there to see Venice not a bathroom. Venice is a very expensive city, so be aware, of water taxis (â‚¬70 from San Marco to the bus stationn 10min trip, wish the concierge had told us when we booked it) and restaurants within the main tourist areas. The Hotel was perfect and would recommend it. The only shame is the bar closes very early, got back to the hotel at 10pm, hoping for a night cap and the bar was closed.

Reviews.Title: “"Lovely Botique Hotel "....”
Reviews.Author: likestocook
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a wonderful 7 night stay at the Hotel Flora. We were especially pleased with the kind and helpful treatment we received from the desk staff, Sergio and Giovanni, and the breakfast waiter, Stefano. Our bed was very comfortable and the morning breakfast buffet and cappucinos were a perfect way to start the day. The hotel location was great with an easy stroll to San Marco Square or the Rialto. We are looking forward to return to Venice and would definitely make reservations to stay at the Flora!

Reviews.Title: “Excellently situated small hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolineSWLondon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at this charming well situated hotel. Having read some of the comments on TA, I was worried that it would turn out to be a mistake. This was far from the case. We had a delightful, although on the small side, room overlooking the attractive courtyard with a well designed small bathroom. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly and we had an excellent breakfast every morning. We would certainly return to the Flora. It is so conveniently situated and quiet and I am sure it is an oasis during the summer months with its lovely garden. We will certainly recommend the hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: ElwoodMelbourne
Reviews.Content: After reading the glowing reviews of this small hotel on the Trip Advisor website and in the current Eyewitness Travel Guide for Venice, as well as having looked at the hotel's own website, we were expecting a small, but thoroughly charming hotel. Sadly we were very disappointed. As we were spending a week in Venice to celebrate a big birthday of mine, we really wanted something special. And at 300 euros a night for a superior room overlooking the garden, we thought we'd find that. Instead on arrival we found a hotel with generally surly staff on the reception counter and very shabby common areas (worn and grubby carpet, scuff-marked walls). Our room, although generous in size, did not appear to be furnished with antiques as mentioned in very cleverly designed, but completely misleading website, but reproduction furniture. The decor felt outdated and there were absolutely no extras included in the room - no robes, no mini bar, and only two plastic glasses (like those you get in economy class on a plane) wrapped in gladwrap on the bathroom shelf. At less than a metre wide, the bathroom itself was the narrowest I've ever been in which made using the facilities, let alone drying oneself adequately, almost impossible. The shower was at one end of the 'bath-corridor', with the heated towel rail located inside the shower cubicle! Breakfasts in the dimly lit downstairs lounge were passable but not 'rich' nor lavish as suggested by the website, however the waiting staff in the dining room were very sweet. To sum up, the position of the hotel is great, but for this kind of money there are a great many other better choices. Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Charm”
Reviews.Author: ccctravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Flora last weekend with my parents. We had a fantastic stay. The hotel is in a very nice, upscale area mere moments from San Marco and the ACTV/Allilugana stop. It is also only a 10 minute walk or so to the Rialto. Everyone was gracious and helpful from the minute we arrived! We felt as welcome as we would in someone's home! The courtyard is beautiful and relaxing after a long day! My parents had a fantasic room with a view of the courtyard, the decore is very "shabby chic" with antique pieces and Venetian Style Decore! We thought it was perfect. The beds and linens were very comfortable which is great after a long day of touring. I had a single room that was the perfect size for one! Breakfast was very nice and they had yummy cappuccinos in the morning! Staying at Hotel Flora when in Venice will always be on the top of my list!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Garden, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: phyllis777
Reviews.Content: The pictures you see of the garden are accurate. It is quite nice. Our room, on the other hand, was quite small. I've travelled throughout Italy and realize that room sizes are not what we experience here in the states. However, our bathroom was so small, it was difficult to use the facilities. You had to squeeze through the shower door to get in. Once in, you could not bend down if you dropped something to pick it up. Also there was a window with clear glass in the shower which was very uncomfortable. I had to open it up and throw a towel over it for privacy. The people at the front desk were rude. I must say though, that the breakfast was very good and the server during breakfast was very polite, cheerful and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AKK77
Reviews.Content: This was a brill hotel. Extremely friendly staff and great location. The room size is smaller than average but they do have different sizes and the size is not that important when in Venice. The room was very clean and was done up everyday. Although the furniture is classic which gives the room a great character the bathroom was very modern with power shower. The location is great, it is just a two min walk from San Marco Square and easy to get to from the airport. Staff all speak a range of languages and go out their way to help. If we would not have had to go back home we would have moved in. ( ; If we ever go to Venice again this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Flora”
Reviews.Author: St_PaulLeb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 2 nights at the Hotel Flora in Venice, Italy. We loved everything about the place. Venice is truly a magical place for couples. The Hotel Flora was perfect for us. Our room was lovely, clean, and roomy. The decor was beautiful and the view of the garden below was really special. The staff was friendly, efficient and very helpful. Breakfast in the garden was a wonderful way to start the day. Eggs, fruit, cereal, bread, rolls, etc., as well as fresh orange juice and excellent coffee or cappuccino. We were very pleased with the Hotel Flora and will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MomWriter
Reviews.Content: Friends stayed here and told us it was nice. We are wary of unknown hotels but Hotel Flora is so beautiful. We had a Quad family room and it was large, airy, three windows to views of neighboring courtyards. Nice breakfast included. Evening light meals or desserts and drinks in the courtyard were peaceful and lovely. Staff is amazingly helpful, steering us to good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The Flora- a blooming treat”
Reviews.Author: Golfing-Steve
Reviews.Content: The Flora is a small gem. Situated in the prime shopping street of Calle Marzo XXII hard on the western side of St Mark's Square this is a superb and quiet location for people who want a top flight base to explore Venice. Although it does not offer evening meals it is within a few minutes walk of some fine eateries and also some less expensive venues to be found in Santa Croce and Dorsodouro, two of the city's six sestiere or quarters. The staff are excellent, especially Stefano who waits on table at breakfast which is served, weather permitting, in the delightful garden to the rear of the hotel. So if it is that good why have I not given it five stars? Two reasons: one the beds and pillows could have been made from pig iron and there is very little storage space in the bedroom we were staying in for which we paid â‚¬260 per night. Space is tight in any good hotel in Venice but we really struggled to find enough space in the bathroom to put our toiletries and could have done with more coat hangers and shelves in the wardrobe. Cupboard space is minimal. But this is still a great base for a visit, especially if it is your first visit and unlike many other hotels on the lagoon is an oasis of peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pontificator
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in mid March for 3 days. The hotel is in a hard to find but excellent location a few minutes away from St. marks Square (the heart of Venice). It is in an area surrounded by really expensive looking hotels and shops. We found this hotel after a late arrival and no room booked and were given a small comfortable room overlooking an alley. The bed was excellent but the bathroom was cramped even by European standards. We were transfered to a room overlooking the beautiful garden for our second and third nights - with a bigger bathoom at the same price (E140). This is a really elegant hotel for the price, the desk staff, especially the manager, were excellent as were the beds, bedding and breakfast . The garden was wonderful after a long day of walking and floating. Highly recommended and romantic -especially "the garden room/s"

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous local hotel in fab location!”
Reviews.Author: luxurybackpacker
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Flora for two nights in early December with my ten year old daughter and we loved it. The hotel had been recommended by a friend who works often at the opera and always stays there when in Venice. It is in a fantastic location - 3 minutes from St Marks square and just off a fashionable shopping street, yet quiet and cosy and very Italian. The staff were fantastic and particularly treated my daughter like a real lady rather than a kid which she loved. Breakfast buffet was just right and cappucinos top grade. We found ourselves popping back in several times a day for a rest and a drink to refuel for yet more sights and walking. It is old world charm however, so if you like a huge bed and all mod cons of a business style hotel, you might be less enamoured, but if you like chandeliers, beautiful wardrobes and ornate wallpaper you will be happy. But above all it was the staff that charmed us - and of course the beautiful outlook from our room over the garden.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christopher-Robin
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Venice where we stayed 2 nights at Hotel Flora during Carnevale. The Hotel was really peaceful and beautiful, the staff were very friendly and helpful without being too instrusive and our room was very large and beautifully decorated with a lovely view over the garden. We had plenty of room to change into our 18th century costumes for the ball we were attending and the location of the hotel made it easy to reach San Marco. Breakfast was lovely the hot chocolate was especially nice and the room where it was served was very charming and relaxing. The garden looked very nice but it was too cold in January to enjoy. We had a fabulous weekend the carnevale and the Ball were fantastic and Hotel Flora made it all extra special. We will be back!!! Claire and Mike Lakey

Reviews.Title: “The highlight of our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: msmelis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Flora for the first part of our honeymoon. We have seriously talked about going there for some part of every future trip we take abroad. It is the perfect blend of beauty and charm. The staff were amazing and had the ideal cappuccino waiting for me as soon as I headed down the stairs each morning. Breakfast in the garden is delightful. Even better is sipping wine by candlelight there late at night. Our luggage had been lost (actually didn't return until we got back to the U.S.A.), but we hardly noticed while being lost in Venice and the romance of Flora.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolCallaghan
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Venice for my 40th Birthday. It was a wonderful experience in a beautiful city. Hotel Flora was the icing on the cake! Very central just a couple of minutes from St Marks square but hidden away in a quiet spot with a lovely garden. It was wonderful to have breakfast in the sunshine. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. We were given advise of where we could find nice restaurants - all found just as described, gondola ride was arranged for us at a very reasonable price and I'm sure any other request would have been met. Our room was clean and had lovely antique furniture and venician chandelier. wonderful place to stay and would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An overall good experience.”
Reviews.Author: Anna-Roz
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Venice and a repeat stay at the Flora. For this second visit, we reserved a four (4) night stay in a superior double. However, later on we chose to arrive in Venice two (2) nights earlier than originally planned, which resulted in an inconvenience of having to move after the first two nights. Still, the inconvenience was of our own doing; it all worked out fine and we were generally happy with our second stay at the Flora. The room we stayed in for the first two (2) nights was pretty but very-very small; however, we were warned by the management that this is what it would be so no surprises there. As indicated above, after the first two (2) nights, we were transferred to room no. 28, which was absolutely gorgeous with a large antique bed, the softest linens and dawn comforters, and a high ceiling with dark wood beams. The room had beautiful wood furnishings, hardwood floors, and floor rugs. It also had two windows overlooking a palazzo across the garden. Even though rather small with not much space to arrange one's necessities or to move around, the bathroom was newly remodeled. In all honesty, though, the room was just beautiful and I would recommend asking for it specifically. Flora also serves a very nice breakfast, consisting of several varieties of breads and croissants, hard and soft boiled eggs, cheeses, yogurts, and pastry. A huge plus is that the Flora, unlike other hotels in Italy, serves a fresh fruit salad every morning. Somewhat of a minus is that a glass of orange juice is served from the kitchen, as opposed to being a part of the breakfast buffet, and it is quite obviously diluted with water. The morning wait staff is extremely helpful and attentive, and will look out for when one's cappuccino is finished so that they could offer a second cup. We were also fortunate enough to score one warm and sunny morning and have breakfast in the garden of the hotel. As far as the front desk personnel, some of them are more accommodating than others, as is the case with anything else in life, and we did notice that one of the front desk attendants was treating guests with a polite tolerance rather than genuine hospitality. Another issue, I would mildly caution against a blind acceptance of Flora's dining recommendations, since the recommended restaurants were only o.k. As far as my recommendations for a good meal, I would suggest the following three and would warn against dining at a fourth: Birraria la Corte, San Polo, Tel.: [--], has a menu full of wonderful offerings. However, we stuck to the recommended by a friend arugula salad with thin slices of pecorino cheese all drizzled with chestnut honey, and pizza with porcini mushrooms and wild boar salami. Delicious! Since we were walking all of those calories off, we treated ourselves to a dessert of pana cota with caramello and were ready to lick the plate if no one would notice. We enjoyed a great lunch at Alla Madonna, Calle Della Madonna, San Polo, Tel. [--]. Unfortunately, they do not take reservations and this is the reason we chose to have lunch rather than dinner when the restaurant gets much busier. Both of us had a plate of pasta (I had the best spaghetti with squid ink) and we shared an appetizer of proscutto and melone. Vini Da Gigio, Cannaregio, Tel.: [--], serves traditional Venetian food at a relatively reasonable prices in a very pleasant atmosphere. My fegato veneciano (liver and onions), my husband's branzino (seabass), and our first courses of pasta were wonderful, as was sgroppino for dessert. Now, I would strongly advise against dining at Trattoria da Remigio in Castello, because I cannot recall any other occasion in any other restaurant, either in the States or abroad, where we were treated with such snootiness and disregard as we were at this establishment, and after hearing the same comments from others, I understand that we did not catch the place on a bad day. There are many other terrific restaurant in Venice--pick those instead.

Reviews.Title: “Marginal ok but stay eleswhere if you can”
Reviews.Author: RonUSA
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms. Bathroom barely useable. Comfortable bed but insect bites every morning. Location is good and the garden is a delightful place. The staff was too formal and the overall atmosphere stuffy to the point of snobby. Don't ask staff for help like where to eat type questions. We received poor service and were charged far too much when we made that mistake. We did far better just walking in on crowded places. Breakfast was the best part of the day there. On the upside, we spent very little time at the hotel. We were out and about all day only using the hotel to change and sleep. I felt the hotel was a bit too expensive for what they offered in the way of services but then again this is Venice and one should expect to overpay for just about everything. Oddly Venice itself is worth it all.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful Flower in the Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Kittylover
Reviews.Content: Originally, I went to the Net to find a Venice hotel. But my daughter was in Venice and stayed at Hotel Flora a month before. She highly recommended it, and personally booked us the biggest suite on the 4th floor. There were 3 of us traveling for 3 nights, and the room was perfect for us. Breakfast was included and delivered to our room, promptly each morning. Our room was huge, with a king size bed, single bed, table and chairs, dressing table and large armoir and dresser. The bathroom was adequate, and would be my only fault of the whole experience. It was very small, but with beautiful tile and new fixtures. The hotel staff couldn't be friendlier. The front desk staff, bartender/waiter, and the bell staff were perfect. The bartender was also the waiter and also the cook! He was so much fun. Every evening we met in the bar for drinks and on one occasion decided to eat there. The meal selection was 2 items, but the quality and price was great. The location was perfect, a short walk from the ferry and St Marks, but be ready to carry your luggage up over one bridge. If you were never in Venice it may be hard to find. In fact, one day when we went separate directions from my daughter, we did get lost for about 20 minutes. However, the location was very quiet at night. Very good mattresses and sleeping. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet very good hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Magsters
Reviews.Content: Our first stop in Italy among 5 other cities and all recommended or reviewed on TripAdvisor. Overall, a very good hotel in an excellent location. Not a large, touristy, overpriced hotel (unless you're looking for that), but rather a quiet, secluded oasis just west of San Marco. The best feature is the breakfast area in the middle of a courtyard amid ivy-covered walls, a bird fountain and serenity. It gave us the feeling of being in a quiet romantic Tuscan villa. We travelled with 2 children ages 9,12 and our room was one queen and 2 temporary cots - large enough for our 2-night stay. Very nice rooms but padded with fabric (although no mustiness or odor was detected). Highly recommended, helpful staff. NOTE: Save 100 euro by avoiding the overrated gondola and instead spend 100 euro by taking a private water taxi to a stop just 1 minute from the hotel. Much better view of Venice from the outside and through the main canal. 45 minutes direct by water taxi may also avoid the longer but cheaper route by public transportation. See my photo of the courtyard, as peaceful as it looks.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, quiet and central: perfect!”
Reviews.Author: BippyBee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Carnevale and it was instrumental in ensuring we had a fabulous time. Our room was small but it was beautifully furnished, and it felt and looked exactly as a cosy, romantic Venetian hotel should. (Larger, and rather opulent-looking rooms are available, I discovered, as I peered in a couple whilst they were being cleaned...Presumably they cost extra: we went for the cheapest.) There is a bar/lounge area downstairs, so after a long tiring journey we were pleased to be able to order a couple of bellinis, and it was nice to be able to pop back to the hotel at the end of an evening out and enjoy a brandy or two. Despite being really close to St Mark's and off a busy shopping street, the hotel itself was really quiet, and it really felt like a little secret hideaway in the midst of the crazy carnival crowds. I really don't have any criticisms of this hotel at all: for Venice it wasn't badly priced, considering location, tranquillity, furnishings and overall standards of cleanliness. The staff were nice and friendly too, tolerating my appalling Italian with grace and charm.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: TBird7
Reviews.Content: Charming! Staying at the Hotel Flora made our trip to Venice magical. The staff were exceptional! Giovanni especially, whose suggestions of where to go, where to eat made our holiday more than we could of asked for especially the dinner at restaurant Monaco. Our room captured a true venetian atmosphere and was very clean and in the height of summer was very cool. It overlooked an internal garden which captured the true secret garden feeling. This is where we had our wonderful breakfasts watching small birds enjoy the water fountain whilst we took in the scent of the flowers surrounding us. Location was superb and very central, a short distance from San Marco, shopping, restaurants and the Grand Canal. A small note to anyone visiting Venice travel lightly and if parking a car call the hotel to find out which car park they have a discount with. We will be back....Thank you again Hotel Flora.....truly magical and in fact we couldn't bring ourselves to leave and extended another 2 days!

Reviews.Title: “Charming with good location”
Reviews.Author: Msafiri1
Reviews.Content: Located not far from St Mark's Square, this hotel offers good value (by Venetian standards) in a charming conversion of an old palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the middle of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: RockyMontana
Reviews.Content: Hotel Flora is nestled between stores on a lovely shopping street but placed back off the main traffic area (foot traffic, of course since there are no automobiles in Venice). It is very quiet, the staff are extremely helpful (tried valiently to locate my lost baggage) and the best part is the beautiful courtyard where breakfast is served in the morning and wine in the evening. The hotel serves a limited-menu dinner, however, we did not eat there. You need to ask about it, they don't advertise. The rooms were small and bathrooms smaller! but with oodles of charm and romance - also very clean! We would stay there again and hope we can soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Matt500
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Flora is a wonderful place to stay while touring in Venice. It has a very central location- near the San Marco Square. They also have a very nice breakfast buffet that comes with the room. We had a very charming room overlooking a garden. The staff was very helpful. Also, there is a very charming room for cocktails and a place to relax. This place is a real find, and I highly recommend it..

Reviews.Title: “This hotel and Venice were both a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Suess567
Reviews.Content: We drove from Milan and took the waterbus to San Marco. We had trouble locating the street/alley address on our map for the hotel. A helpful man on the waterbus gave us directions. After a long day of driving Italian style (scary!), we were happy to find this lovely hotel. Our room small but very clean and quiet. My aunt was happy to have two twin beds instead of the usual one single bed. The breakfast buffet was extensive and was a nice way to start our day of sightseeing. Venice is beautiful and the weather was sunny and warm. Took an waterbus to Lido and walked across the island to the gorgeous beach. Had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Choose the superior deluxe room”
Reviews.Author: felicityLondon
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - less than 5 min from San Marco, down a quaint alley offf the designer shops street. Hotel lobby/public rooms - very small entrance, rather dated interior and did worry me about the room. considering the hotel is not cheap, the public areas don't really encourage you to sit and relax with other guests. Room - This is what made me love my stay at Hotel Flora. We chose the superior deluxe room on 3rd floor i think. The room was very large, the bed was huge and the decor was venetian and antique wood. The space was truly beautiful and what I imagined a venetian bedroom would be like. I did have a nose in another room next to ours which was considerably small and pokey - rather surprising. I think the key is to book in this smaller hotel but only go if you get one of the best rooms. Service - Very pleasant, helpful but not as fantastic as others have made out. Breakfast - We had breakfast delivered to our rooms as the lounge area downstairs really wasn't that great. I understand the norm is to have it in the courtyard, which is pretty, but too wet in winter. Consisted of cereal, croissants, OJ and tea. Very simple, not a great choice or fantasically fresh, but fine for us. So, in all, I would definately recommend this but only if you get the best room. We compared prices to the Grand Monaco and had a look at the rooms - swish entrance but the superior rooms were tiny, standardised and although you got a canal view the windows were pokey. After that, we realised our hotel was a true Venetian experience

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant find”
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Flora and would recommend it to any visitor to Venice. Tucked away off one of the nicest streets near St Mark's Square with it's own beautiful courtyard in which to enjoy a lovely breakfast or an evening drink. The bedrooms are small and simply furnished in a classic Venetian style, however this added to our whole experience. The staff were so friendly and couldn't have been more welcoming. You'll definitely have to look hard to find this hotel, but it's well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot - right in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: rsg62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Flora for two nights. It was the perfect location in Venice - down a quiet side street right off St. Mark's. The staff was unbelievably accomodating and helpful. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Traveler082006
Reviews.Content: Hotel Flora location is good, just a few minute walk to St Marks Square. The courtyard is a nice place to have breakfast and relax at the end of the day. The room furnishings need to be updated, chair was worn and a bit dirty looking. I awoke with many bug bites on legs and believe it came from the bed. The bathroom was very small. Overall I would not return because of the bug bites, which are still visable after 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well located, comfortable, outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: DrWeniki
Reviews.Content: I really, really liked the Hotel Flora. Charming, very pretty, great location. Website's photos are very representative of hotel. Just 2-3 minutes from St. Mark's Square and the St. Mark's Square vaporetto exit (and thankfully, only one bridge with steps cross), and on a well marked alleyway just off the "Rodeo Drive" of Venice, the Via 22 Marzo, not that street names mean anything here. Totally by luck, my vanDam StreetSmart Venice map that I had brought with me had the Hotel Flora marked on it. So, I actually knew how to find the hotel (not an easy thing in Venice!) Venice was horribly hot, so we appreciated the best AC we've ever had! Lots of Americans here. After our long, hot journey via train and overcrowded vaporetto feeling cranky and weary from lugging our overstuffed bags thru the crowded streets of Venice, we turned the corner to the charming alleyway well marked by the "Hotel Flora" sign from above, the bellman opened the door and walked down to meet us as if they were expecting us. The bellman took our bags from us and ushered us into the well air-conditioned lobby. Indeed they were expecting us as the concierge greeted us by name, quickly checked us in and had the bellman efficiently escort us to our comfortably cooled room. (OK, that's the limit of my journalistic stylings.) The room and bathroom were incredibly tiny, but we did only reserve a standard room. There really wasn't any room for our bags without climbing over them. But, the bed and comforters were just the best. The hot/cold water were plentiful. There was American Kleenex brand facial tissue which was a strange but nice comfort to have! The toiletries and towels were lush. Our 180 euro room was tiny #29 (on the 3rd floor not the 2nd!) and overlooked the lovely courtyard. Judging by the hotel map, looks like larger rooms were available. The included breakfast was nicely continental, and more substantial items like eggs or prosciutto with melon could be ordered and were reasonably priced. The servers remembered us and our food preferences everyday! The concierges were very polite and helpful and gently encouraged us to ask them for help and recommendations with a very non-intrusive "what are you doing today?" And then would very politely encourage us to do other things if they thought it would be too crowded and would produce maps and recommendations (my husband wanted to go to St. Mark's first thing in the morning, but the concierge managed to rightly convince him that going in the less crowded afternoon would be better). Again, the concierges were outstanding. Ok, a plus, but in conversing with one of them, found we may be distantly related cousins as his wife and my husband are from the same village in Shanghai of all places. You need a login ID and password from the concierge which is doled out in unfortunately small time increments for the free internet (We'd get only 1/2 hour increments, but I'm sure if we asked for a longer increment, we'd have gotten it.) I'd definitely stay here again for the charm, wonderful staff, great location, beautiful courtyard, comfy beds, best-in-class AC, free wireless internet, totally worth it price, all totally making up for our tiny room (which sort of grew on us). Next time, we'll just maybe upgrade to a larger room!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the money”
Reviews.Author: MikeandCarmelyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Flora for two nights during our honeymoon. The room was a bit drab. Make sure you ask for a courtyard view. I hear the top floor corner room is the best. The staff was pretty helpful. The breakfast (included) was quite nice. The entrance is kind of off the beaten path (down an alley) which I thought was a good thing. The best part about the place (other than the reasonable price for Venice) is the location. The hotel is literally a 3 minute walk from San Marco square and it is very close to the water taxi. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Room too Small and No AC”
Reviews.Author: emma123
Reviews.Content: Yes, it has a great location, just steps from St. Marks, but this hotel was a disappointment, based on our tiny room on the top floor of the hotel (clearly, was originally for staff) and the smallest bathroom on the planet (clearly, there was originally no bathroom in this room). On top of that, because of a dubious "law" that said hotels couldn't use AC until June 1, we had none, and sweltered all night when not fending off the bugs. Worst night sleep you could imagine. Stay at the Hotel Mocenigo instead, where we had a blissful three nights (with AC, I might add) in a huge, spotless and charming bedroom with giant bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “World class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having spent more than 30 years in the hotel trade myself, I feel strongly enough to write a quick review of the Hotel Flora having just spent three days there. Credit must be given to the owners of this business for assembling staff who are the most charming, attentive and efficient that it has been my pleasure to stay with just about anywhere in the world! There are many reviews on this hotel that explain the location etc, so I would only add that if you do not wish to be disturbed at breakfast time, ask for a room that is not on the ground floor adjacent to the garden area. Otherwise I'd recommend this as a superb hotel in a fantastic city!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Flora-Charming small hotel”
Reviews.Author: lonestartravels
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Flora for 2 nights. It is a small, charming but slightly worn hotel. It has the feel of a large villa, rather than a hotel. We had an extremely large triple at the back of the hotel-room 23 with a small, modern bathroom. The heated floor and heated towel bar were a nice touch. The rooms are decorated in Venetian style. The hotel is in a great location, and the concierge provided detailed instructions on how to get there from the train station. A typical Italian continental breakfast was included in the price of the room (205 euros). It was very cold so we were unable to sit in the lovely courtyard in the center. The courtyard filled with iron tables and chairs would be a wonderful place to relax and have a drink at the end of the day. The hotel staff were very attentive. I would highly recommend this hotel to travelers who like small hotels with a flavor of the city which they are visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Flora for 1 night (Sept 17). We thought it was very nice. PROS: - pretty hotel - great location - 5 min walk to St. Marks - delicious breakfast - croissants, cheese, fruit, yogurt, etc - pretty garden for breakfast, and pretty lobby, breakfast room, etc - friendly staff - free internet PC in breakfast room - nice toiletries in washroom CONS: - room was nice but nothing exciting and a bit small for the price; hairdryer didn't work - very expensive (230 euros a night) We thought it was a lovely hotel (as you can see by the photos I posted).. we would consider staying here again, but due to the cost and the fact the room was just average, we would probably look around at other hotels too for a better value.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Retreat off of St Mark's”
Reviews.Author: travelin'bunch
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 4-bedded family room (2 adults 2 kids) which was huge by Venician standards. The location is barely 5 minutes off of St. Mark's and perfect if you need a quiet retreat that is still within the hustle of it all. The hotel garden is beautiful and a great place for breakfast. It rained for us so we were served in the breakfast room. Be prepared to spend alot in Venice. Dinner might cost you almost the same as a room! Bring boots if traveling soon and be ready for fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Location is terrific, hotel is ok.”
Reviews.Author: Julwin
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Flora came with great recommendations. You could not beat the location--5 minutes from the Piazza San Marco--but our room was MINISCULE!! We could not enter or exit the bathroom without knocking the hair dryer out of its holder. Our room had a musty smell, but then most of Venice has a musty smell...I wasn't sure if this is the Hotel Flora or Venice in general. Everything in Venice is very expensive and this hotel was the most expensive of our entire trip and the most disappointing due to the size of the room. T I give high marks to the staff--they were quite helpful and friendly--we could not fault our service while there. They arranged for a free boat to Murano as well as arranged our private taxi on our departure. We would not stay at this hotel again due to the high price and very small room...but the neighborhood was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: bitsandpieces
Reviews.Content: Here's the ups: Terrific location 5 minutes walk from St Mark's, breakfast was a very nice spread including eggs, breakfast garden was pleasant to look at, bellman were excellent, very close to a canal for private departure to airport. Here's the downs: Hallways were absolutely in need of renovation, room was definitely TIRED, shower head didn't work, had to wait to get a seat at breakfast, if you arrived late for breakfast, there were no eggs left, the construction going on right outside our bedroom window and the breakfast garden. The thing that bugged me most is the dinner recommendation for the Hosteria ai Coristi (restaurant). I should have known better. We didn't even say we were going there, but when we did arrive, our name was on the reservation list (obviously so the guy at the hotel got his commission). If that happens to you anywhere in Venice, run the other direction. Do not eat at this TOTAL tourist trap. I'm not going to waste my time writing why. If you are looking for a nice meal, albeit pricey, try Corte Sconta for fresh seafood or nearby L'Osteria de Santa Marina. If you're looking for a nice hotel, you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: oxenburgh
Reviews.Content: Lovely, pleasant hotel quietly tucked away off the smart S. Marco shopping street. Hearty breakfast included and enjoyed in the walled garden. Waiters and staff are all polity, funny, friendly and helpful. This hotel is so conveniently located, 5 min. walk from arrival by the Alilaguna transport from Venice airport. Equally close walking distance to St. Mark's Square and Vaporetta. Highly recommended for at 3 star hotel and we will definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable-hits the right note!”
Reviews.Author: tcsteve
Reviews.Content: Hotel Flora has cute rooms complete with charm, small but useful bathrooms, tv, views and an adorable garden where you can have breakfast or a drink. The location is in the middle of it all yet tucked away from noise. If Venice is the first stop on your trip as it was for us, it is a great place to "land" and sleep off a little jet lag and wake up and be really close to the sights and shops of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: tqj
Reviews.Content: Loved every minute of the stay here. The staff is very service-oriented led by their wonderful concierge, Sergio. He handled three changes in our travel plans to other hotels in Italy within a very short period of time during a busy morning. The gentlemen serving the morning breakfast make every effort to learn your name or room number quickly as well as provide a pleasant personality to their service. You are a 5-minute walk from the water taxi (very efficient from the train station) and easy to find. Get off at the first St. Mark's stop by Harry's Bar. Go staight to the main street, turn left and it is a short walk over a small canal bridge on your left. It is set back from the street, thus making it very quiet. The room is a bit smallish, but worked for us. You will appreciate its convenience even more as you walk through the streets of Venice and watch other travelers walking all corners of the city with suitcases and maps looking for their hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Flora was AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel, with charming rooms. The garden (where the included, delicious, and energizing breakfast was served) was spectacular. Hotel Flora is very near to San Marco Square and other crowded, busy, tourist-filled attractions, but the hotel still managed to be peaceful, calm, and relaxed. The staff were fun, accomodating, and always helpful. My family loves Hotel Flora!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: keira78
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of my favorites. It is a small boutique hotel, keeping with the old style of Venice in the St. Mark's Square area. The courtyard is beautiful and you have the option of breakfast in bed, courtyard or in the breakfast room. The waiter is extremely friendly, breakfast is average, and the capps are included with breakfast and are great! FREE INTERNET on the hotel computer. The concierge even arranged a boat trip to Murano, free of charge and we didn't buy anything there. Did I mention? FREE INTERNET!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not terrific”
Reviews.Author: Barbeque
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by the quality of the hotel given the glowing reviews I had seen. This hotel is in a terrific location, with friendly staff, but the rooms were on the small and tired side, and my bathroom was dated and cramped -- I couldn't actually stand up straight in the shower. My room looked onto a wall, but at least the soundproofing was fine --no noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Molto bene!”
Reviews.Author: shellm
Reviews.Content: Our bathroom was very small, but other than that- excellent! Great value for the $. Good breakfast, charming lobby, friendly and helpful staff. Until I become a millionaire this is where I will stay in Venezia!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: helmi
Reviews.Content: We liked the location, the venetian style of the interior decoration , the patio, the breakfast, the atmosphere as a whole etc. etc.

Reviews.Title: “The Flora is Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took our first trip to Italy in June, 04. We stayed at the Flora Hotel in Venice. It was lovely. A very helpful English speaking staff, and the Courtyard garden was a wonderful place . The location is just a minute walk to St. Marks Square.This was our favorite place we stayed, and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, cute patio, and great location. The room was small, but overlooked the patio which made it feel bigger. A bit Old World so the rooms and common areas can be a bit dark, but we thought it just added more character. It seemed like the most European of all of our hotels and actually became the favorite from our trip.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Flora
